   20: 
   21: -module(port_SUITE).
   22: 
   23: %%%
   24: %%% Author: Bjorn Gustavsson; iter_max_ports contributed by Peter Hogfeldt.
   25: %%%
   26: 
   27: %%
   28: %% There are a lot of things to test with open_port(Name, Settings).
   29: %%
   30: %%   Name can be
   31: %%
   32: %%       {spawn, Command}
   33: %%         which according to The Book and the manual page starts an
   34: %%         external program. That is not true. It might very well be
   35: %%         a linked-in program (the notion of 'linked-in driver' is
   36: %%         silly, since any driver is 'linked-in').
   37: %%	       [Spawn of external program is tested.]
   38: %%
   39: %%       {fd, In, Out}
   40: %%         Open file descriptors In and Out. [Not tested]
   41: %%
   42: %%   PortSettings can be
   43: %%
   44: %%       {packet, N}
   45: %%         N is 1, 2 or 4.
   46: %%
   47: %%       stream (default)
   48: %%         Without packet length.
   49: %%
   50: %%       use_stdio (default for spawned ports)
   51: %%         The spawned process use file descriptors 0 and 1 for I/O.
   52: %%
   53: %%       nouse_stdio					[Not tested]
   54: %%         Use filedescriptors 3 and 4.  This option is probably only
   55: %%	   meaningful on Unix.
   56: %%
   57: %%       in (default for Atom)
   58: %%         Input only (from Erlang's point of view).
   59: %%
   60: %%       out
   61: %%         Output only (from Erlang's point of view).
   62: %%
   63: %%       binary
   64: %%         The port is a binary port, i.e. messages received and sent
   65: %%         to a port are binaries.
   66: %%
   67: %%       eof
   68: %%         Port is not closed on eof and will not send an exit signal,
   69: %%         instead it will send a {Port, eof} to the controlling process
   70: %%         (output can still be sent to the port (??)).
   71: %%
   72: 
   73: 
   74: -export([all/0, suite/0, groups/0, init_per_testcase/2, end_per_testcase/2,
   75:          init_per_suite/1, end_per_suite/1]).

   77:     badarg_port_with_atom/1,
   78:     bad_args/1,
   79:     bad_env/1,

   88:     dying_port/1,
   89:     env/1,

   91:     exit_status/1,

  101:     mon_port_bad_remote_on_local/1,
  102:     mon_port_local/1,
  103:     mon_port_name_demonitor/1,
  104:     mon_port_named/1,
  105:     mon_port_origin_dies/1,
  106:     mon_port_owner_dies/1,
  107:     mon_port_pid_demonitor/1,
  108:     mon_port_remote_on_remote/1,

  165: suite() ->
  166:     [{ct_hooks,[ts_install_cth]},
  167:      {timetrap, {minutes, 1}}].

  173:      port_program_with_path, name1, env, huge_env, bad_env, cd,
  174:      cd_relative, pipe_limit_env, bad_args, badarg_port_with_atom,
  175:      exit_status, iter_max_ports, count_fds, t_exit, {group, tps}, line,

  179:      spawn_executable, close_deaf_port, unregister_name,

  192:      mon_port_driver_die,
  193:      {group, port_exit_signal_race}].
  194: 
  195: groups() ->
  196:     [{stream, [], [stream_small, stream_big]},
  197:      {options, [], [t_binary, eof, input_only, output_only]},
  198:      {multiple_packets, [], [mul_basic, mul_slow_writes]},
  199:      {tps, [], [tps_16_bytes, tps_1K]},
  200:      {port_exit_signal_race, [], [port_exit_monitor_race,
  201:                                   port_exit_demonitor_race,
  202:                                   port_exit_link_race,
  203:                                   port_exit_unlink_race,
  204:                                   port_exit_command_race,
  205:                                   port_exit_connect_race,
  206:                                   port_exit_close_race,
  207:                                   port_exit_exit_race,
  208:                                   port_exit_command_request_race,
  209:                                   port_exit_connect_request_race,
  210:                                   port_exit_close_request_race,
  211:                                   port_exit_control_request_race,
  212:                                   port_exit_call_request_race,
  213:                                   port_exit_info_request_race]}].
  214: 
  215: init_per_testcase(Case, Config) when Case =:= mon_port_driver_die;
  216:                                      Case =:= mon_port_driver_die_demonitor ->
  217:     case erlang:system_info(schedulers_online) of
  218:         1 -> {skip, "Need 2 schedulers to run testcase"};
  219:         _ -> Config
  220:     end;
  221: init_per_testcase(Case, Config) ->
  222:     [{testcase, Case} |Config].
  223: 
  224: end_per_testcase(_Case, Config) ->
  225:     erts_test_utils:ept_check_leaked_nodes(Config).
  226: 
  227: init_per_suite(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  228:     ignore_cores:init(Config).
  229: 
  230: end_per_suite(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  231:     ignore_cores:fini(Config).
  232: 
  233: 
  234: -define(WIN_MASSIVE_PORT, 50000).
  235: 
  236: %% Tests that you can open a massive amount of ports (sockets)
  237: %% on a Windows machine given the correct environment.
  238: win_massive(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  239:     case os:type() of
  240:         {win32,_} ->
  241:             do_win_massive();
  242:         _ ->
  243:             {skip,"Only on Windows."}
  244:     end.
  245: 
  246: do_win_massive() ->
  247:     ct:timetrap({minutes, 6}),
  248:     {ok, Peer, Node} = ?CT_PEER(["+Q", "8192"]),
  249:     ok = rpc:call(Node,?MODULE,win_massive_client,[3000]),
  250:     peer:stop(Peer).
  251: 
  252: win_massive_client(N) ->
  253:     {ok,P}=gen_tcp:listen(?WIN_MASSIVE_PORT,[{reuseaddr,true}]),
  254:     L = win_massive_loop(P,N),
  255:     Len = length(L),
  256:     lists:foreach(fun(E) ->
  257:                           gen_tcp:close(E)
  258:                   end,
  259:                   L),
  260:     case Len div 2 of
  261:         N ->
  262:             ok;
  263:         _Else ->
  264:             {too_few, Len}
  265:     end.
  266: 
  267: win_massive_loop(_,0) ->
  268:     [];
  269: win_massive_loop(P,N) ->
  270:     case (catch gen_tcp:connect("localhost",?WIN_MASSIVE_PORT,[])) of
  271:         {ok,A} ->
  272:             case (catch gen_tcp:accept(P)) of
  273:                 {ok,B} ->
  274:                     %erlang:display(N),
  275:                     [A,B|win_massive_loop(P,N-1)];
  276:                 _Else ->
  277:                     [A]
  278:             end;
  279:         _Else0 ->
  280:             []
  281:     end.
  282: 
  283: 
  284: %% Test that we can send a stream of bytes and get it back.
  285: %% We will send only a small amount of data, to avoid deadlock.
  286: 
  287: stream_small(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  288:     stream_ping(Config, 512, "", []),
  289:     stream_ping(Config, 1777, "", []),
  290:     stream_ping(Config, 1777, "-s512", []),
  291:     ok.
  292: 
  293: %% Send big amounts of data (much bigger than the buffer size in port test).
  294: %% This will deadlock the emulator if the spawn driver haven't proper
  295: %% non-blocking reads and writes.
  296: 
  297: stream_big(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  298:     ct:timetrap({seconds, 180}),
  299:     stream_ping(Config, 43755, "", []),
  300:     stream_ping(Config, 100000, "", []),
  301:     stream_ping(Config, 77777, " -s40000", []),
  302:     ok.
  303: 
  304: %% Sends packet with header size of 1, 2, and 4, with packets of various
  305: %% sizes.
  306: 
  307: basic_ping(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  308:     ct:timetrap({minutes, 2}),
  309:     ping(Config, sizes(1), 1, "", []),
  310:     ping(Config, sizes(2), 2, "", []),
  311:     ping(Config, sizes(4), 4, "", []),
  312:     ok.
  313: 
  314: %% Let the port program insert delays between characters sent back to
  315: %% Erlang, to test that the Erlang emulator can handle a packet coming in
  316: %% small chunks rather than all at once.
  317: 
  318: slow_writes(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  319:     ping(Config, [8], 4, "-s1", []),
  320:     ping(Config, [10], 2, "-s2", []),
  321:     ok.
  322: 
  323: %% Test that we get {'EXIT', Port, einval} if we try to send a bigger
  324: %% packet than the packet header allows.
  325: bad_packet(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  326:     PortTest = port_test(Config),
  327:     process_flag(trap_exit, true),
  328: 
  329:     bad_packet(PortTest, 1, 256),
  330:     bad_packet(PortTest, 1, 257),
  331:     bad_packet(PortTest, 2, 65536),
  332:     bad_packet(PortTest, 2, 65537),
  333:     ok.
  334: 
  335: bad_packet(PortTest, HeaderSize, PacketSize) ->
  336:     P = open_port({spawn, PortTest}, [{packet, HeaderSize}]),
  337:     P ! {self(), {command, make_zero_packet(PacketSize)}},
  338:     receive
  339:         {'EXIT', P, einval} -> ok;
  340:         Other -> ct:fail({unexpected_message, Other})
  341:     end.
  342: 
  343: make_zero_packet(0) -> [];
  344: make_zero_packet(N) when N rem 2 == 0 ->
  345:     P = make_zero_packet(N div 2),
  346:     [P|P];
  347: make_zero_packet(N) ->
  348:     P = make_zero_packet(N div 2),
  349:     [0, P|P].
  350: 
  351: %% Test sending bad messages to a port.
  352: bad_port_messages(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  353:     PortTest = port_test(Config),
  354:     process_flag(trap_exit, true),
  355: 
  356:     bad_message(PortTest, {a,b}),
  357:     bad_message(PortTest, {a}),
  358:     bad_message(PortTest, {self(),{command,bad_command}}),
  359:     bad_message(PortTest, {self(),{connect,no_pid}}),
  360:     ok.
  361: 
  362: bad_message(PortTest, Message) ->
  363:     P = open_port({spawn,PortTest}, []),
  364:     P ! Message,
  365:     receive
  366:         {'EXIT',P,badsig} -> ok;
  367:         Other -> ct:fail({unexpected_message, Other})
  368:     end.
  369: 
  370: %% Tests various options (stream and {packet, Number} are implicitly
  371: %% tested in other test cases).
  372: 
  373: 
  374: %% Tests the 'binary' option for a port.
  375: 
  376: t_binary(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  377:     ct:timetrap({seconds, 300}),
  378: 
  379:     %% Packet mode.
  380:     ping(Config, sizes(1), 1, "", [binary]),
  381:     ping(Config, sizes(2), 2, "", [binary]),
  382:     ping(Config, sizes(4), 4, "", [binary]),
  383: 
  384:     %% Stream mode.
  385:     stream_ping(Config, 435, "", [binary]),
  386:     stream_ping(Config, 43755, "", [binary]),
  387:     stream_ping(Config, 100000, "", [binary]),
  388:     ok.
  389: 
  390: name1(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  391:     ct:timetrap({seconds, 100}),
  392:     PortTest = port_test(Config),
  393:     Command = lists:concat([PortTest, " "]),
  394:     P = open_port({spawn, Command}, []),
  395:     register(myport, P),
  396:     P = whereis(myport),
  397:     Text = "hej",
  398:     myport ! {self(), {command, Text}},
  399:     receive
  400:         {P, {data, Text}} ->
  401:             ok
  402:     end,
  403:     myport ! {self(), close},
  404:     receive
  405:         {P, closed} -> ok
  406:     end,
  407:     undefined = whereis(myport),
  408:     ok.
  409: 
  410: %% Test that the 'eof' option works.
  411: 
  412: eof(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  413:     ct:timetrap({seconds, 100}),
  414:     PortTest = port_test(Config),
  415:     Command = lists:concat([PortTest, " -h0 -q"]),
  416:     P = open_port({spawn, Command}, [eof]),
  417:     receive
  418:         {P, eof} ->
  419:             ok
  420:     end,
  421:     P ! {self(), close},
  422:     receive
  423:         {P, closed} -> ok
  424:     end,
  425:     ok.
  426: 
  427: %% Tests that the 'in' option for a port works.
  428: 
  429: input_only(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  430:     ct:timetrap({seconds, 300}),
  431:     expect_input(Config, [0, 1, 10, 13, 127, 128, 255], 1, "", [in]),
  432:     expect_input(Config, [0, 1, 255, 2048], 2, "", [in]),
  433:     expect_input(Config, [0, 1, 255, 2048], 4, "", [in]),
  434:     expect_input(Config, [0, 1, 10, 13, 127, 128, 255],
  435:                  1, "", [in, binary]),
  436:     ok.
  437: 
  438: %% Tests that the 'out' option for a port works.
  439: 
  440: output_only(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  441:     ct:timetrap({seconds, 100}),
  442:     Dir = proplists:get_value(priv_dir, Config),
  443: 
  444:     %% First we test that the port program gets the data
  445:     Filename = filename:join(Dir, "output_only_stream"),
  446:     Data = random_packet(35777, "echo"),
  447:     output_and_verify(Config, ["-h0 -o", Filename], Data),
  448:     Wait_time = 500,
  449:     test_server:sleep(Wait_time),
  450:     {ok, Written} = file:read_file(Filename),
  451:     Data = binary_to_list(Written),
  452: 
  453:     %% Then we test that any writes to stdout from
  454:     %% the port program is not sent to erlang
  455:     output_and_verify(Config, ["-h0"], Data),
  456:     ok.
  457: 
  458: output_and_verify(Config, Options, Data) ->
  459:     PortTest = port_test(Config),
  460:     Command = lists:concat([PortTest, " " | Options]),
  461:     Port = open_port({spawn, Command}, [out]),
  462:     Port ! {self(), {command, Data}},
  463:     Port ! {self(), close},
  464:     receive
  465:         {Port, closed} -> ok;
  466:         Msg -> ct:fail({received_unexpected_message, Msg})
  467:     end.
  468: 
  469: %% Test that receiving several packages written in the same
  470: %% write operation works.
  471: 
  472: 
  473: %% Basic test of receiving multiple packages, written in
  474: %% one operation by the other end.
  475: mul_basic(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  476:     ct:timetrap({minutes, 10}),
  477:     expect_input(Config, [0, 1, 255, 10, 13], 1, "", []),
  478:     expect_input(Config, [0, 10, 13, 1600, 32767, 65535], 2, "", []),
  479:     expect_input(Config, [10, 70000], 4, "", []),
  480:     ok.
  481: 
  482: %% Test reading a buffer consisting of several packets, some
  483: %% of which might be incomplete.  (The port program builds
  484: %% a buffer with several packets, but writes it in chunks with
  485: %% delays in between.)
  486: 
  487: mul_slow_writes(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  488:     ct:timetrap({minutes, 4}),
  489:     expect_input(Config, [0, 20, 255, 10, 1], 1, "-s64", []),
  490:     ok.
  491: 
  492: %% Runs several port tests in parallell.  Each individual test
  493: %% finishes in about 5 seconds.  Running in parallell, all tests
  494: %% should also finish in about 5 seconds.
  495: 
  496: parallell(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  497:     ct:timetrap({minutes, 5}),
  498:     Testers = [
  499:                fun() -> stream_ping(Config, 1007, "-s100", []) end,
  500:                fun() -> stream_ping(Config, 10007, "-s1000", []) end,
  501:                fun() -> stream_ping(Config, 10007, "-s1000", []) end,
  502: 
  503:                fun() -> expect_input(Config, [21, 22, 23, 24, 25], 1,
  504:                                      "-s10", [in]) end,
  505: 
  506:                fun() -> ping(Config, [10], 1, "-d", []) end,
  507:                fun() -> ping(Config, [20000], 2, "-d", []) end,
  508:                fun() -> ping(Config, [101], 1, "-s10", []) end,
  509:                fun() -> ping(Config, [1001], 2, "-s100", []) end,
  510:                fun() -> ping(Config, [10001], 4, "-s1000", []) end,
  511: 
  512:                fun() -> ping(Config, [501, 501], 2, "-s100", []) end,
  513:                fun() -> ping(Config, [11, 12, 13, 14, 11], 1, "-s5", []) end],
  514:     process_flag(trap_exit, true),
  515:     Pids = lists:map(fun fun_spawn/1, Testers),
  516:     wait_for(Pids),
  517:     ok.
  518: 
  519: wait_for([]) ->
  520:     ok;
  521: wait_for(Pids) ->
  522:     io:format("Waiting for ~p", [Pids]),
  523:     receive
  524:         {'EXIT', Pid, normal} ->
  525:             wait_for(lists:delete(Pid, Pids));
  526:         Other ->
  527:             ct:fail({bad_exit, Other})
  528:     end.
  529: 
  530: %% Tests starting port programs that terminate by themselves.
  531: %% This used to cause problems on Windows.
  532: 
  533: dying_port(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  534:     ct:timetrap({minutes, 2}),
  535:     process_flag(trap_exit, true),
  536: 
  537:     P1 = make_dying_port(Config),
  538:     P2 = make_dying_port(Config),
  539:     P3 = make_dying_port(Config),
  540:     P4 = make_dying_port(Config),
  541:     P5 = make_dying_port(Config),
  542: 
  543:     %% This should be big enough to be sure to block in the write.
  544:     Garbage = random_packet(16384),
  545: 
  546:     P1 ! {self(), {command, Garbage}},
  547:     P3 ! {self(), {command, Garbage}},
  548:     P5 ! {self(), {command, Garbage}},
  549: 
  550:     wait_for_port_exit(P1),
  551:     wait_for_port_exit(P2),
  552:     wait_for_port_exit(P3),
  553:     wait_for_port_exit(P4),
  554:     wait_for_port_exit(P5),
  555:     ok.
  556: 
  557: wait_for_port_exit(Port) ->
  558:     receive
  559:         {'EXIT', Port, _} ->
  560:             ok
  561:     end.
  562: 
  563: make_dying_port(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  564:     PortTest = port_test(Config),
  565:     Command = lists:concat([PortTest, " -h0 -d -q"]),
  566:     open_port({spawn, Command}, [stream]).
  567: 
  568: %% Test that dropped port_commands work correctly.
  569: %% This used to cause a segfault.
  570: %%
  571: %% This testcase creates a port and then lets many processes
  572: %% do parallel commands to it. After a while it closes the
  573: %% port and we are trying to catch the race when doing a
  574: %% command while the port is closing.
  575: dropped_commands(Config) ->
  576:     %% Test with output callback
  577:     dropped_commands(Config, false, {self(), {command, "1"}}),
  578:     %% Test with outputv callback
  579:     dropped_commands(Config, true, {self(), {command, "1"}}).
  580: 
  581: dropped_commands(Config, Outputv, Cmd) ->
  582:     Path = proplists:get_value(data_dir, Config),
  583:     os:putenv("ECHO_DRV_USE_OUTPUTV", atom_to_list(Outputv)),
  584:     ok = load_driver(Path, "echo_drv"),
  585:     [dropped_commands_test(Cmd) || _ <- lists:seq(1, 100)],
  586:     timer:sleep(100),
  587:     erl_ddll:unload_driver("echo_drv"),
  588:     os:unsetenv("ECHO_DRV_USE_OUTPUTV"),
  589:     ok.
  590: 
  591: dropped_commands_test(Cmd) ->
  592:     spawn_monitor(
  593:       fun() ->
  594:               Port = erlang:open_port({spawn_driver, "echo_drv"},
  595:                                       [{parallelism, true}]),
  596:               [spawn_link(fun() -> spin(Port, Cmd) end) || _ <- lists:seq(1,8)],
  597:               timer:sleep(5),
  598:               port_close(Port),
  599:               timer:sleep(5),
  600:               exit(nok)
  601:       end),
  602:     receive _M -> timer:sleep(5) end.
  603: 
  604: spin(P, Cmd) ->
  605:     P ! Cmd,
  606:     spin(P, Cmd).
  607: 
  608: 
  609: %% Tests that port program with complete path (but without any
  610: %% .exe extension) can be started, even if there is a file with
  611: %% the same name but without the extension in the same directory.
  612: %% (In practice, the file with the same name could be a Unix
  613: %% executable.)
  614: %%
  615: %% This used to failed on Windows (the .exe extension had to be
  616: %% explicitly given).
  617: %%
  618: %% This testcase works on Unix, but is not very useful.
  619: 
  620: port_program_with_path(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  621:     ct:timetrap({minutes, 2}),
  622:     DataDir = proplists:get_value(data_dir, Config),
  623:     PrivDir = proplists:get_value(priv_dir, Config),
  624: 
  625:     %% Create a copy of the port test program in a directory not
  626:     %% included in PATH (i.e. in priv_dir), with the name 'my_port_test.exe'.
  627:     %% Also, place a file named 'my_port_test' in the same directory.
  628:     %% This used to confuse the CreateProcess() call in spawn driver.
  629:     %% (On Unix, there will be a single file created, which will be
  630:     %% a copy of the port program.)
  631: 
  632:     PortTest = os:find_executable("port_test", DataDir),
  633:     io:format("os:find_executable(~p, ~p) returned ~p",
  634:               ["port_test", DataDir, PortTest]),
  635:     {ok, PortTestPgm} = file:read_file(PortTest),
  636:     NewName = filename:join(PrivDir, filename:basename(PortTest)),
  637:     RedHerring = filename:rootname(NewName),
  638:     ok = file:write_file(RedHerring, "I'm just here to confuse.\n"),
  639:     ok = file:write_file(NewName, PortTestPgm),
  640:     ok = file:write_file_info(NewName, #file_info{mode=8#111}),
  641:     PgmWithPathAndNoExt = filename:rootname(NewName),
  642: 
  643:     %% Open the port using the path to the copied port test program,
  644:     %% but without the .exe extension, and verified that it was started.
  645:     %%
  646:     %% If the bug is present the open_port call will fail with badarg.
  647: 
  648:     Command = lists:concat([PgmWithPathAndNoExt, " -h2"]),
  649:     P = open_port({spawn, Command}, [{packet, 2}]),
  650:     Message = "echo back to me",
  651:     P ! {self(), {command, Message}},
  652:     receive
  653:         {P, {data, Message}} ->
  654:             ok
  655:     end,
  656:     ok.
  657: 
  658: %% Tests that ports can no longer be opened using atoms
  659: badarg_port_with_atom(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  660:     PrivDir = proplists:get_value(priv_dir, Config),
  661:     File = filename:join(PrivDir, "port_file"),
  662:     case catch open_port(File, [eof]) of
  663:         {'EXIT', {badarg, _}} ->
  664:             ok
  665:     end,
  666: 
  667:     case catch open_port(atom_port, [eof]) of
  668:         {'EXIT', {badarg, _}} ->
  669:             ok
  670:     end,
  671:     ok.
  672: 
  673: %% Tests that all appropriate fd's have been closed in the port program
  674: count_fds(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  675:     case os:type() of
  676:         {unix, _} ->
  677:             PrivDir = proplists:get_value(priv_dir, Config),
  678:             Filename = filename:join(PrivDir, "my_fd_counter"),
  679: 
  680:             RunTest = fun(PortOpts) ->
  681:                               PortTest = port_test(Config),
  682:                               Command = lists:concat([PortTest, " -n -f -o", Filename]),
  683:                               Port = open_port({spawn, Command}, PortOpts),
  684:                               Port ! {self(), close},
  685:                               receive
  686:                                   {Port, closed} -> ok
  687:                               end,
  688:                               test_server:sleep(500),
  689:                               {ok, Written} = file:read_file(Filename),
  690:                               Written
  691:                       end,
  692:             <<4:32/native>> = RunTest([out, nouse_stdio]),
  693:             <<4:32/native>> = RunTest([in, nouse_stdio]),
  694:             <<5:32/native>> = RunTest([in, out, nouse_stdio]),
  695:             <<3:32/native>> = RunTest([out, use_stdio]),
  696:             <<3:32/native>> = RunTest([in, use_stdio]),
  697:             <<3:32/native>> = RunTest([in, out, use_stdio]),
  698:             <<3:32/native>> = RunTest([in, out, use_stdio, stderr_to_stdout]),
  699:             <<3:32/native>> = RunTest([out, use_stdio, stderr_to_stdout]);
  700:         _ ->
  701:             {skip, "Skipped on windows"}
  702:     end.
  703: 
  704: %%
  705: %% Open as many ports as possible. Do this several times and check
  706: %% that we get the same number of ports every time.
  707: %%
  708: 
  709: iter_max_ports(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  710:     %% The child_setup program might dump core if we get out of memory.
  711:     %% This is hard to do anything about and is harmless. We run this test
  712:     %% in a working directory with an ignore_core_files file which will make
  713:     %% the search for core files ignore cores generated by this test.
  714:     %%
  715:     Config2 = ignore_cores:setup(?MODULE, iter_max_ports, Config, true),
  716:     try
  717:         iter_max_ports_test(Config2)
  718:     after
  719:         ignore_cores:restore(Config2)
  720:     end.
  721: 
  722: 
  723: iter_max_ports_test(Config) ->
  724:     ct:timetrap({minutes, 30}),
  725:     PortTest = port_test(Config),
  726:     Command = lists:concat([PortTest, " -h0 -q"]),
  727:     Iters = case os:type() of
  728:                 {win32,_} -> 4;
  729:                 _ -> 10
  730:             end,
  731:     %% Run on a different node in order to limit the effect if this test fails.
  732:     {ok, Peer, Node} = ?CT_PEER(["+Q", "2048"]),
  733:     L = rpc:call(Node,?MODULE,do_iter_max_ports,[Iters, Command]),
  734:     peer:stop(Peer),
  735: 
  736:     ct:log("Result: ~p",[L]),
  737:     all_equal(L),
  738:     all_equal(L),
  739:     {comment, "Max ports: " ++ integer_to_list(hd(L))}.
  740: 
  741: do_iter_max_ports(N, Command) when N > 0 ->
  742:     [max_ports(Command)| do_iter_max_ports(N-1, Command)];
  743: do_iter_max_ports(_, _) ->
  744:     [].
  745: 
  746: all_equal([E,E|T]) ->
  747:     all_equal([E|T]);
  748: all_equal([_]) -> ok;
  749: all_equal([]) -> ok.
  750: 
  751: max_ports(Command) ->
  752:     test_server:sleep(500),
  753:     Ps = open_ports({spawn, Command}, [eof]),
  754:     N = length(Ps),
  755:     close_ports(Ps),
  756:     io:format("Got ~p ports\n",[N]),
  757:     N.
  758: 
  759: close_ports([P|Ps]) ->
  760:     P ! {self(), close},
  761:     receive
  762:         {P,closed} ->
  763:             ok
  764:     end,
  765:     close_ports(Ps);
  766: close_ports([]) ->
  767:     ok.
  768: 
  769: open_ports(Name, Settings) ->
  770:     case os:type() of
  771:         {unix, freebsd} ->
  772:             %% FreeBsd has issues with sendmsg/recvmsg in fork
  773:             %% implementation and we therefore have to spawn
  774:             %% slower to make sure that we always hit the same
  775:             %% make roof.
  776:             test_server:sleep(10);
  777:         _ ->
  778:             test_server:sleep(5)
  779:     end,
  780:     case catch open_port(Name, Settings) of
  781:         P when is_port(P) ->
  782:             [P| open_ports(Name, Settings)];
  783:         {'EXIT', {Code, _}} ->
  784:             case Code of
  785:                 enfile ->
  786:                     [];
  787:                 emfile ->
  788:                     [];
  789:                 system_limit ->
  790:                     [];
  791:                 enomem ->
  792:                     [];
  793:                 Other ->
  794:                     ct:fail({open_ports, Other})
  795:             end;
  796:         Other ->
  797:             ct:fail({open_ports, Other})
  798:     end.
  799: 
  800: %% Tests that exit(Port, Term) works (has been known to crash the emulator).
  801: 
  802: t_exit(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  803:     process_flag(trap_exit, true),
  804:     Pid = fun_spawn(fun suicide_port/1, [Config]),
  805:     receive
  806:         {'EXIT', Pid, die} ->
  807:             ok;
  808:         Other ->
  809:             ct:fail({bad_message, Other})
  810:     end.
  811: 
  812: suicide_port(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  813:     Port = port_expect(Config, [], 0, "", []),
  814:     exit(Port, die),
  815:     receive after infinity -> ok end.
  816: 
  817: 
  818: tps_16_bytes(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  819:     tps(16, Config).
  820: 
  821: tps_1K(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  822:     tps(1024, Config).
  823: 
  824: tps(Size, Config) ->
  825:     ct:timetrap({minutes, 5}),
  826:     PortTest = port_test(Config),
  827:     Packet = list_to_binary(random_packet(Size, "e")),
  828:     Port = open_port({spawn, PortTest}, [binary, {packet, 2}]),
  829:     Transactions = 10000,
  830:     {Elapsed, ok} = test_server:timecall(?MODULE, tps,
  831:                                          [Port, Packet, Transactions]),
  832:     {comment, integer_to_list(trunc(Transactions/Elapsed+0.5)) ++ " transactions/s"}.
  833: 
  834: tps(_Port, _Packet, 0) -> ok;
  835: tps(Port, Packet, N) ->
  836:     port_command(Port, Packet),
  837:     receive
  838:         {Port, {data, Packet}} ->
  839:             tps(Port, Packet, N-1);
  840:         Other ->
  841:             ct:fail({bad_message, Other})
  842:     end.
  843: 
  844: %% Line I/O test
  845: line(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  846:     ct:timetrap({minutes, 5}),
  847:     Siz = 110,
  848:     Packet1 = random_packet(Siz),
  849:     Packet2 = random_packet(Siz div 2),
  850:     %% Test that packets are split into lines
  851:     port_expect(Config,[{lists:append([Packet1, io_lib:nl(), Packet2,
  852:                                        io_lib:nl()]),
  853:                          [{eol, Packet1}, {eol, Packet2}]}],
  854:                 0, "", [{line,Siz}]),
  855:     %% Test the same for binaries
  856:     port_expect(Config,[{lists:append([Packet1, io_lib:nl(), Packet2,
  857:                                        io_lib:nl()]),
  858:                          [{eol, Packet1}, {eol, Packet2}]}],
  859:                 0, "", [{line,Siz},binary]),
  860:     %% Test that too long lines get split
  861:     port_expect(Config,[{lists:append([Packet1, io_lib:nl(), Packet1,
  862:                                        Packet2, io_lib:nl()]),
  863:                          [{eol, Packet1}, {noeol, Packet1},
  864:                           {eol, Packet2}]}], 0, "", [{line,Siz}]),
  865:     %% Test that last output from closing port program gets received.
  866:     L1 = lists:append([Packet1, io_lib:nl(), Packet2]),
  867:     S1 = lists:flatten(io_lib:format("-l~w", [length(L1)])),
  868:     io:format("S1 = ~w, L1 = ~w~n", [S1,L1]),
  869:     port_expect(Config,[{L1,
  870:                          [{eol, Packet1}, {noeol, Packet2}, eof]}], 0,
  871:                 S1, [{line,Siz},eof]),
  872:     %% Test that lonely <CR> Don't get treated as newlines
  873:     port_expect(Config,[{lists:append([Packet1, [13], Packet2,
  874:                                        io_lib:nl()]),
  875:                          [{noeol, Packet1}, {eol, [13 |Packet2]}]}],
  876:                 0, "", [{line,Siz}]),
  877:     %% Test that packets get built up to lines (delayed output from
  878:     %% port program)
  879:     port_expect(Config,[{Packet2,[]},
  880:                         {lists:append([Packet2, io_lib:nl(),
  881:                                        Packet1, io_lib:nl()]),
  882:                          [{eol, lists:append(Packet2, Packet2)},
  883:                           {eol, Packet1}]}], 0, "-d", [{line,Siz}]),
  884:     %% Test that we get badarg if trying both packet and line
  885:     bad_argument(Config, [{packet, 5}, {line, 5}]),
  886:     ok.
  887: 
  888: %% Test that redirection of standard error to standard output works.
  889: stderr_to_stdout(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  890:     ct:timetrap({minutes, 1}),
  891:     %% See that it works
  892:     Packet = random_packet(10),
  893:     port_expect(Config,[{Packet,[Packet]}], 0, "-e -l10",
  894:                 [stderr_to_stdout]),
  895:     %% stream_ping(Config, 10, "-e", [stderr_to_stdout]),
  896:     %% See that it doesn't always happen (will generate garbage on stderr)
  897:     port_expect(Config,[{Packet,[eof]}], 0, "-e -l10", [line,eof]),
  898:     ok.
  899: 
  900: 
  901: bad_argument(Config, ArgList) ->
  902:     PortTest = port_test(Config),
  903:     case catch open_port({spawn, PortTest}, ArgList) of
  904:         {'EXIT', {badarg, _}} ->
  905:             ok
  906:     end.
  907: 
  908: 
  909: %% 'env' option
  910: %% (Can perhaps be made smaller by calling the other utility functions
  911: %% in this module.)
  912: %%
  913: %% Test that the 'env' option works
  914: env(Config)  when is_list(Config) ->
  915:     ct:timetrap({minutes, 1}),
  916:     Priv = proplists:get_value(priv_dir, Config),
  917:     Temp = filename:join(Priv, "env_fun.bin"),
  918: 
  919:     PluppVal = "dirty monkey",
  920:     env_slave(Temp, [{"plupp",PluppVal}]),
  921: 
  922:     Long = "LongAndBoringEnvName",
  923:     os:putenv(Long, "nisse"),
  924: 
  925:     env_slave(Temp, [{"plupp",PluppVal},
  926:                      {"DIR_PLUPP","###glurfrik"}],
  927:               fun() ->
  928:                       PluppVal = os:getenv("plupp"),
  929:                       "###glurfrik" = os:getenv("DIR_PLUPP"),
  930:                       "nisse" = os:getenv(Long)
  931:               end),
  932: 
  933: 
  934:     env_slave(Temp, [{"must_define_something","some_value"},
  935:                      {"certainly_not_existing",false},
  936:                      {"ends_with_equal", "value="},
  937:                      {Long,false},
  938:                      {"glurf","a glorfy string"}]),
  939: 
  940:     %% A lot of non existing variables (mingled with existing)
  941:     NotExistingList = [{lists:flatten(io_lib:format("V~p_not_existing",[X])),false}
  942:                        ||  X <- lists:seq(1,150)],
  943:     ExistingList = [{lists:flatten(io_lib:format("V~p_existing",[X])),"a_value"}
  944:                     ||  X <- lists:seq(1,150)],
  945:     env_slave(Temp, lists:sort(ExistingList ++ NotExistingList)),
  946:     ok.
  947: 
  948: env_slave(File, Env) ->
  949:     F = fun() ->
  950:                 lists:foreach(fun({Name,Val}) ->
  951:                                       Val = os:getenv(Name)
  952:                               end, Env)
  953:         end,
  954:     env_slave(File, Env, F).
  955: 
  956: env_slave(File, Env, Body) ->
  957:     file:write_file(File, term_to_binary(Body)),
  958:     Program = ct:get_progname(),
  959:     Dir = filename:dirname(code:which(?MODULE)),
  960:     Cmd = Program ++ " -pz " ++ Dir ++
  961:     " -noinput -run " ++ ?MODULE_STRING ++ " env_slave_main " ++
  962:     File ++ " -run erlang halt",
  963:     Port = open_port({spawn, Cmd}, [{env,Env},{line,256}]),
  964:     receive
  965:         {Port,{data,{eol,"ok"}}} ->
  966:             ok;
  967:         {Port,{data,{eol,Error}}} ->
  968:             ct:fail("eol error ~p\n", [Error]);
  969:         Other ->
  970:             ct:fail(Other)
  971:     end.
  972: 
  973: env_slave_main([File]) ->
  974:     {ok,Body0} = file:read_file(File),
  975:     Body = binary_to_term(Body0),
  976:     case Body() of
  977:         {'EXIT',Reason} ->
  978:             io:format("Error: ~p\n", [Reason]);
  979:         _ ->
  980:             io:format("ok\n")
  981:     end,
  982:     init:stop().
  983: 
  984: 
  985: %% 'env' option
  986: %%   Test bad environments.
  987: bad_env(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  988:     try_bad_env([abbb]),
  989:     try_bad_env([{"key","value"}|{"another","value"}]),
  990:     try_bad_env([{"key","value","value2"}]),
  991:     try_bad_env([{"key",[a,b,c]}]),
  992:     try_bad_env([{"key",value}]),
  993:     try_bad_env({a,tuple}),
  994:     try_bad_env(42),
  995:     try_bad_env([a|b]),
  996:     try_bad_env(self()),
  997:     ok.
  998: 
  999: try_bad_env(Env) ->
 1000:     badarg = try open_port({spawn,"ls"}, [{env,Env}])
 1001: 	     catch
 1002: 		 error:badarg -> badarg
 1003: 	     end.
 1004: 
 1005: 
 1006: %% Test that we can handle a very very large environment gracefully.
 1007: huge_env(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 1008:     ct:timetrap({minutes, 2}),
 1009:     {Vars, Cmd} = case os:type() of
 1010:                       {win32,_} -> {500, "cmd /q /c ls"};
 1011:                       _ ->
 1012:                           %% We create a huge environment,
 1013:                           %% 20000 variables is about 25MB
 1014:                           %% which seems to be the limit on Linux.
 1015:                           {20000, "ls"}
 1016:                   end,
 1017:     Env = [{[$a + I div (25*25*25*25) rem 25,
 1018:              $a + I div (25*25*25) rem 25,
 1019:              $a + I div (25*25) rem 25,
 1020:              $a+I div 25 rem 25, $a+I rem 25],
 1021:             lists:duplicate(100,$a+I rem 25)}
 1022:            || I <- lists:seq(1,Vars)],
 1023:     try erlang:open_port({spawn,Cmd},[exit_status, {env, Env}]) of
 1024:         P ->
 1025:             receive
 1026:                 {P, {exit_status,N}} = M when N > 127->
 1027:                     %% If exit status is > 127 something went very wrong
 1028:                     ct:fail("Open port failed got ~p",[M]);
 1029:                 {P, {exit_status,N}} = M ->
 1030:                     %% We test that the exit status is an integer, this means
 1031:                     %% that the child program has started. If we get an atom
 1032:                     %% something went wrong in the driver which is not ok.
 1033:                     ct:log("Got ~p",[M]),
 1034:                     true = is_integer(N)
 1035:             end
 1036:     catch E:R ->
 1037:               %% Have to catch the error here, as printing the stackdump
 1038:               %% in the ct log is way to heavy for some test machines.
 1039:               ct:fail("Open port failed ~p:~p",[E,R])
 1040:     end.
 1041: 
 1042: %% Test to spawn program with command payload buffer
 1043: %% just around pipe capacity (9f779819f6bda734c5953468f7798)
 1044: pipe_limit_env(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 1045:     WSL = os:getenv("WSLENV") =/= false,
 1046:     Cmd = case os:type() of
 1047:               {win32,_} when WSL -> "cmd.exe /q /c wsl true";
 1048:               {win32,_} -> "cmd /q /c true";
 1049:               _ -> "true"
 1050:           end,
 1051:     CmdSize = command_payload_size(Cmd),
 1052:     Limits = [4096, 16384, 65536], % Try a couple of common pipe buffer sizes
 1053: 
 1054:     lists:foreach(fun(Lim) ->
 1055: 			  lists:foreach(fun(L) -> pipe_limit_env_do(L, Cmd, CmdSize)
 1056: 					end, lists:seq(Lim-5, Lim+5))
 1057: 		  end, Limits),
 1058:     ok.
 1059: 
 1060: pipe_limit_env_do(Bytes, Cmd, CmdSize) ->
 1061:     case env_of_bytes(Bytes-CmdSize) of
 1062: 	[] -> skip;
 1063: 	Env ->
 1064: 	    try erlang:open_port({spawn,Cmd},[exit_status, {env, Env}]) of
 1065: 		P ->
 1066: 		    receive
 1067: 			{P, {exit_status,N}} ->
 1068: 			    %% Bug caused exit_status 150 (EINVAL+128)
 1069: 			    0 = N
 1070: 		    end
 1071: 	    catch E:R ->
 1072: 		    %% Have to catch the error here, as printing the stackdump
 1073: 		    %% in the ct log is way to heavy for some test machines.
 1074: 		    ct:fail("Open port failed ~p:~p",[E,R])
 1075: 	    end
 1076:     end.
 1077: 
 1078: %% environ format: KEY=VALUE\0
 1079: env_of_bytes(Bytes) when Bytes > 3 ->
 1080:     [{"X",lists:duplicate(Bytes-3, $x)}];
 1081: env_of_bytes(_) -> [].
 1082: 
 1083: %% White box assumption about payload written to pipe
 1084: %% for Cmd and current environment (see spawn_start in sys_driver.c)
 1085: command_payload_size(Cmd) ->
 1086:     EnvSize = lists:foldl(fun(E,Acc) -> length(E) + 1 + Acc end,
 1087: 			  0, os:getenv()),
 1088:     {ok, PWD} = file:get_cwd(),
 1089:     (4                      % buffsz
 1090:      + 4                    % flags
 1091:      + 5 + length(Cmd) + 1  % "exec $Cmd"
 1092:      + length(PWD) + 1      % $PWD
 1093:      + 1                    % nullbuff
 1094:      + 4                    % env_len
 1095:      + EnvSize).
 1096: 
 1097: %%  Test bad 'args' options.
 1098: bad_args(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 1099:     try_bad_args({args, [self()]}),
 1100:     try_bad_args({args, ["head" | "tail"]}),
 1101:     try_bad_args({args, ["head", "body" | "tail"]}),
 1102:     try_bad_args({args, [<<"head">>, <<"body">> | <<"tail">>]}),
 1103:     try_bad_args({args, not_a_list}),
 1104:     try_bad_args({args, ["string",<<"binary">>, 1472, "string"]}),
 1105:     try_bad_args({args, ["string",<<"binary">>], "element #3"}),
 1106:     ok.
 1107: 
 1108: try_bad_args(Args) ->
 1109:     badarg = try open_port({spawn_executable,"ls"}, [Args])
 1110: 	     catch
 1111: 		 error:badarg -> badarg
 1112: 	     end.
 1113: 
 1114: 
 1115: 
 1116: %% 'cd' option
 1117: %% (Can perhaps be made smaller by calling the other utility functions
 1118: %% in this module.)
 1119: %%
 1120: %% Test that the 'cd' option works
 1121: cd(Config)  when is_list(Config) ->
 1122:     ct:timetrap({minutes, 1}),
 1123: 
 1124:     Program = ct:get_progname(),
 1125:     DataDir = proplists:get_value(data_dir, Config),
 1126:     TestDir = filename:join(DataDir, "dir"),
 1127:     Cmd = Program ++ " -pz " ++ DataDir ++
 1128:     " -noshell -s port_test pwd -s erlang halt",
 1129:     _ = open_port({spawn, Cmd},
 1130:                   [{cd, TestDir}, {line, 256}]),
 1131:     receive
 1132:         {_, {data, {eol, String}}} ->
 1133:             case filename_equal(String, TestDir) of
 1134:                 true ->
 1135:                     ok;
 1136:                 false ->
 1137:                     ct:fail({cd, String})
 1138:             end;
 1139:         Other2 ->
 1140:             ct:fail({env, Other2})
 1141:     end,
 1142:     _ = open_port({spawn, Cmd},
 1143:                   [{cd, unicode:characters_to_binary(TestDir)},
 1144:                    {line, 256}]),
 1145:     receive
 1146:         {_, {data, {eol, String2}}} ->
 1147:             case filename_equal(String2, TestDir) of
 1148:                 true ->
 1149:                     ok;
 1150:                 false ->
 1151:                     ct:fail({cd, String2})
 1152:             end;
 1153:         Other3 ->
 1154:             ct:fail({env, Other3})
 1155:     end,
 1156: 
 1157:     InvalidDir = filename:join(DataDir, "invaliddir"),
 1158:     try open_port({spawn, Cmd},
 1159:                   [{cd, InvalidDir}, exit_status, {line, 256}]) of
 1160:         _ ->
 1161:             receive
 1162:                 {_, {exit_status, _}} ->
 1163:                     ok;
 1164:                 Other4 ->
 1165:                     ct:fail({env, Other4})
 1166:             end
 1167:     catch error:eacces ->
 1168:             %% This happens on Windows
 1169:             ok
 1170:     end,
 1171: 
 1172:     %% Check that there are no lingering messages
 1173:     receive
 1174:         Other5 ->
 1175:             ct:fail({env, Other5})
 1176:     after 10 ->
 1177:             ok
 1178:     end.
 1179: 
 1180: %% Test that an emulator that has set it's cwd to
 1181: %% something other then when it started, can use
 1182: %% relative {cd,"./"} to open port and that cd will
 1183: %% be relative the new cwd and not the original
 1184: cd_relative(Config) ->
 1185: 
 1186:     Program = ct:get_progname(),
 1187:     DataDir = proplists:get_value(data_dir, Config),
 1188:     TestDir = filename:join(DataDir, "dir"),
 1189: 
 1190:     Cmd = Program ++ " -pz " ++ filename:dirname(code:where_is_file("port_SUITE.beam")) ++
 1191:     " -noshell -s port_SUITE relative_cd -s erlang halt",
 1192: 
 1193:     _ = open_port({spawn, Cmd}, [{line, 256}, {cd, TestDir}]),
 1194: 
 1195:     receive
 1196:         {_, {data, {eol, String}}} ->
 1197:             case filename_equal(String, TestDir) of
 1198:                 true ->
 1199:                     ok;
 1200:                 false ->
 1201:                     ct:fail({cd_relative, String})
 1202:             end;
 1203:         Other ->
 1204:             ct:fail(Other)
 1205:     end.
 1206: 
 1207: relative_cd() ->
 1208: 
 1209:     Program = ct:get_progname(),
 1210:     ok = file:set_cwd(".."),
 1211:     {ok, Cwd} = file:get_cwd(),
 1212: 
 1213:     Cmd = Program ++ " -pz " ++ Cwd ++
 1214:     " -noshell -s port_test pwd -s erlang halt",
 1215: 
 1216:     _ = open_port({spawn, Cmd}, [{line, 256}, {cd, "./dir"}, exit_status]),
 1217: 
 1218:     receive
 1219:         {_, {data, {eol, String}}} ->
 1220:             io:format("~s~n",[String]);
 1221:         Other ->
 1222:             io:format("ERROR: ~p~n",[Other])
 1223:     end.
 1224: 
 1225: filename_equal(A, B) ->
 1226:     case os:type() of
 1227:         {win32, _} ->
 1228:             win_filename_equal(A, B);
 1229:         _ ->
 1230:             A == B
 1231:     end.
 1232: 
 1233: win_filename_equal([], []) ->
 1234:     true;
 1235: win_filename_equal([], _) ->
 1236:     false;
 1237: win_filename_equal(_, []) ->
 1238:     false;
 1239: win_filename_equal([C1 | Rest1], [C2 | Rest2]) ->
 1240:     case tolower(C1) == tolower(C2) of
 1241:         true ->
 1242:             win_filename_equal(Rest1, Rest2);
 1243:         false ->
 1244:             false
 1245:     end.
 1246: 
 1247: tolower(C) when C >= $A, C =< $Z ->
 1248:     C + 32;
 1249: tolower(C) ->
 1250:     C.
 1251: 
 1252: %% Tests that child process deaths are managed correctly when there are
 1253: %%  a large amount of concurrently dying children. See ticket OTP-3906.
 1254: otp_3906(Config)  when is_list(Config) ->
 1255:     case os:type() of
 1256:         {unix, OSName} ->
 1257:             otp_3906(Config, OSName);
 1258:         _ ->
 1259:             {skipped, "Only run on Unix systems"}
 1260:     end.
 1261: 
 1262: -define(OTP_3906_CHILDREN,     1000).
 1263: -define(OTP_3906_EXIT_STATUS,  17).
 1264: -define(OTP_3906_PROGNAME,     "otp_3906").
 1265: -define(OTP_3906_TICK_TIMEOUT, 5000).
 1266: -define(OTP_3906_OSP_P_ERLP,   10).
 1267: -define(OTP_3906_MAX_CONC_OSP, 50).
 1268: 
 1269: otp_3906(Config, OSName) ->
 1270:     DataDir = filename:dirname(proplists:get_value(data_dir,Config)),
 1271:     {ok, Variables, _} = file:path_consult(code:get_path(),"variables"),
 1272:     case lists:keysearch('CC', 1, Variables) of
 1273:         {value,{'CC', CC}} ->
 1274:             PrivDir = proplists:get_value(priv_dir, Config),
 1275:             Prog = otp_3906_make_prog(CC, PrivDir),
 1276:             {ok, Peer, Node} = ?CT_PEER(),
 1277:             OP = process_flag(priority, max),
 1278:             OTE = process_flag(trap_exit, true),
 1279:             FS = spawn_link(Node,
 1280:                             ?MODULE,
 1281:                             otp_3906_start_forker_starter,
 1282:                             [?OTP_3906_CHILDREN, [], self(), Prog]),
 1283:             Result = receive
 1284:                          {'EXIT', _ForkerStarter, Reason} ->
 1285:                              {failed, Reason};
 1286:                          {emulator_pid, EmPid} ->
 1287:                              case otp_3906_wait_result(FS, 0, 0) of
 1288:                                  {succeeded,
 1289:                                   ?OTP_3906_CHILDREN,
 1290:                                   ?OTP_3906_CHILDREN} ->
 1291:                                      succeeded;
 1292:                                  {succeeded, Forked, Exited} ->
 1293:                                      otp_3906_list_defunct(EmPid, OSName),
 1294:                                      {failed,
 1295:                                       {mismatch,
 1296:                                        {forked, Forked},
 1297:                                        {exited, Exited}}};
 1298:                                  Res ->
 1299:                                      otp_3906_list_defunct(EmPid, OSName),
 1300:                                      Res
 1301:                              end
 1302:                      end,
 1303:             process_flag(trap_exit, OTE),
 1304:             process_flag(priority, OP),
 1305:             peer:stop(Peer),
 1306:             case Result of
 1307:                 succeeded ->
 1308:                     ok;
 1309:                 _ ->
 1310:                     ct:fail(Result)
 1311:             end;
 1312:         _ ->
 1313:             {skipped, "No C compiler found"}
 1314:     end.
 1315: 
 1316: otp_3906_list_defunct(EmPid, OSName) ->
 1317:     % Guess ps switches to use and what to grep for (could be improved)
 1318:     {Switches, Zombie} = case OSName of
 1319:                              BSD when BSD == darwin;
 1320:                                       BSD == openbsd;
 1321:                                       BSD == netbsd;
 1322:                                       BSD == freebsd ->
 1323:                                  {"-ajx", "Z"};
 1324:                              _ ->
 1325:                                  {"-ef", "[dD]efunct"}
 1326:                          end,
 1327:     io:format("Emulator pid: ~s~n"
 1328:               "Listing of zombie processes:~n"
 1329:               "~s~n",
 1330:               [EmPid,
 1331:                otp_3906_htmlize(os:cmd("ps "
 1332:                                        ++ Switches
 1333:                                        ++ " | grep "
 1334:                                        ++ Zombie))]).
 1335: 
 1336: otp_3906_htmlize([]) ->
 1337:     [];
 1338: otp_3906_htmlize([C | Cs]) ->
 1339:     case [C] of
 1340:         "<" -> "&lt;" ++ otp_3906_htmlize(Cs);
 1341:         ">" -> "&gt;" ++ otp_3906_htmlize(Cs);
 1342:         _ ->   [C | otp_3906_htmlize(Cs)]
 1343:     end.
 1344: 
 1345: otp_3906_make_prog(CC, PrivDir) ->
 1346:     SrcFileName = filename:join(PrivDir, ?OTP_3906_PROGNAME ++ ".c"),
 1347:     TrgtFileName = filename:join(PrivDir, ?OTP_3906_PROGNAME),
 1348:     {ok, SrcFile} = file:open(SrcFileName, write),
 1349:     io:format(SrcFile,
 1350:               "int           ~n"
 1351:               "main(void)    ~n"
 1352:               "{             ~n"
 1353:               "   return ~p; ~n"
 1354:               "}             ~n",
 1355:               [?OTP_3906_EXIT_STATUS]),
 1356:     file:close(SrcFile),
 1357:     os:cmd(CC ++ " " ++ SrcFileName ++ " -o " ++ TrgtFileName),
 1358:     TrgtFileName.
 1359: 
 1360: 
 1361: otp_3906_wait_result(ForkerStarter, F, E) ->
 1362:     receive
 1363:         {'EXIT', ForkerStarter, Reason} ->
 1364:             {failed, {Reason, {forked, F}, {exited, E}}};
 1365:         forked ->
 1366:             otp_3906_wait_result(ForkerStarter, F+1, E);
 1367:         exited ->
 1368:             otp_3906_wait_result(ForkerStarter, F, E+1);
 1369:         tick ->
 1370:             otp_3906_wait_result(ForkerStarter, F, E);
 1371:         succeeded ->
 1372:             {succeeded, F, E}
 1373:     after
 1374:         ?OTP_3906_TICK_TIMEOUT ->
 1375:             unlink(ForkerStarter),
 1376:             exit(ForkerStarter, timeout),
 1377:             {failed, {timeout, {forked, F}, {exited, E}}}
 1378:     end.
 1379: 
 1380: otp_3906_collect([], _) ->
 1381:     done;
 1382: otp_3906_collect(RefList, Sup) ->
 1383:     otp_3906_collect(otp_3906_collect_one(RefList, Sup), Sup).
 1384: 
 1385: otp_3906_collect_one(RefList, Sup) ->
 1386:     receive
 1387:         Ref when is_reference(Ref) ->
 1388:             Sup ! tick,
 1389:             lists:delete(Ref, RefList)
 1390:     end.
 1391: 
 1392: otp_3906_start_forker(N, Sup, Prog) ->
 1393:     Ref = make_ref(),
 1394:     spawn_opt(?MODULE,
 1395:               otp_3906_forker,
 1396:               [N, self(), Ref, Sup, Prog],
 1397:               [link, {priority, max}]),
 1398:     Ref.
 1399: 
 1400: otp_3906_start_forker_starter(N, RefList, Sup, Prog) ->
 1401:     process_flag(priority, max),
 1402:     EmPid = os:getpid(),
 1403:     Sup ! {emulator_pid, EmPid},
 1404:     otp_3906_forker_starter(N, RefList, Sup, Prog).
 1405: 
 1406: otp_3906_forker_starter(0, RefList, Sup, _) ->
 1407:     otp_3906_collect(RefList, Sup),
 1408:     unlink(Sup),
 1409:     Sup ! succeeded;
 1410: otp_3906_forker_starter(N, RefList, Sup, Prog)
 1411:   when length(RefList) >= ?OTP_3906_MAX_CONC_OSP ->
 1412:     otp_3906_forker_starter(N, otp_3906_collect_one(RefList, Sup), Sup, Prog);
 1413: otp_3906_forker_starter(N, RefList, Sup, Prog)
 1414:   when is_integer(N), N > ?OTP_3906_OSP_P_ERLP ->
 1415:     otp_3906_forker_starter(N-?OTP_3906_OSP_P_ERLP,
 1416:                             [otp_3906_start_forker(?OTP_3906_OSP_P_ERLP,
 1417:                                                    Sup,
 1418:                                                    Prog)|RefList],
 1419:                             Sup,
 1420:                             Prog);
 1421: otp_3906_forker_starter(N, RefList, Sup, Prog) when is_integer(N) ->
 1422:     otp_3906_forker_starter(0,
 1423:                             [otp_3906_start_forker(N,
 1424:                                                    Sup,
 1425:                                                    Prog)|RefList],
 1426:                             Sup,
 1427:                             Prog).
 1428: 
 1429: otp_3906_forker(0, Parent, Ref, _, _) ->
 1430:     unlink(Parent),
 1431:     Parent ! Ref;
 1432: otp_3906_forker(N, Parent, Ref, Sup, Prog) ->
 1433:     Port = erlang:open_port({spawn, Prog}, [exit_status, in]),
 1434:     Sup ! forked,
 1435:     receive
 1436:         {Port, {exit_status, ?OTP_3906_EXIT_STATUS}} ->
 1437:             Sup ! exited,
 1438:             otp_3906_forker(N-1, Parent, Ref, Sup, Prog);
 1439:         {Port, Res} ->
 1440:             exit(Res);
 1441:         Other ->
 1442:             exit(Other)
 1443:     end.
 1444: 
 1445: 
 1446: otp_4389(Config)  when is_list(Config) ->
 1447:     case os:type() of
 1448:         {unix, _} ->
 1449:             ct:timetrap({minutes, 4}),
 1450:             TCR = self(),
 1451:             %% On MacOS Catalina libc can return enoent instead of emfile for cwd
 1452:             BrokenCWD = (os:type() =:= {unix,darwin}) andalso element(1,os:version()) == 19,
 1453:             case get_true_cmd() of
 1454:                 True when is_list(True) ->
 1455:                     lists:foreach(
 1456:                       fun (P) ->
 1457:                               receive
 1458:                                   {P, ok} ->  ok;
 1459:                                   {P, Err} -> ct:fail(Err)
 1460:                               end
 1461:                       end,
 1462:                       lists:map(
 1463:                         fun(_) ->
 1464:                                 spawn_link(
 1465:                                   fun() ->
 1466:                                           process_flag(trap_exit, true),
 1467:                                           case catch open_port({spawn, True},
 1468:                                                                [stream,exit_status]) of
 1469:                                               P when is_port(P) ->
 1470:                                                   receive
 1471:                                                       {P,{exit_status,_}} ->
 1472:                                                           TCR ! {self(),ok};
 1473:                                                       {'EXIT',_,{R2,_}}
 1474:                                                         when R2 == emfile;
 1475:                                                              R2 == eagain;
 1476:                                                              R2 == enomem;
 1477:                                                              R2 == enoent andalso BrokenCWD ->
 1478:                                                           TCR ! {self(),ok};
 1479:                                                       Err2 ->
 1480:                                                           TCR ! {self(),{msg,Err2}}
 1481:                                                   end;
 1482:                                               {'EXIT',{R1,_}}
 1483:                                                 when R1 == emfile;
 1484:                                                      R1 == eagain;
 1485:                                                      R1 == enomem;
 1486:                                                      R1 == enoent andalso BrokenCWD ->
 1487:                                                   TCR ! {self(),ok};
 1488:                                               Err1 ->
 1489:                                                   TCR ! {self(), {open_port,Err1}}
 1490:                                           end
 1491:                                   end)
 1492:                         end,
 1493:                         lists:duplicate(1000,[]))),
 1494:                     {comment,
 1495:                      "This test case doesn't always fail when the bug that "
 1496:                      "it tests for is present (it is most likely to fail on"
 1497:                      " a multi processor machine). If the test case fails it"
 1498:                      " will fail by deadlocking the emulator."};
 1499:                 _ ->
 1500:                     {skipped, "\"true\" command not found"}
 1501:             end;
 1502:         _ ->
 1503:             {skip,"Only run on Unix"}
 1504:     end.
 1505: 
 1506: get_true_cmd() ->
 1507:     DoFileExist = fun (FileName) ->
 1508:                           case file:read_file_info(FileName) of
 1509:                               {ok, _} -> throw(FileName);
 1510:                               _ -> not_found
 1511:                           end
 1512:                   end,
 1513:     catch begin
 1514:               %% First check in /usr/bin and /bin
 1515:               DoFileExist("/usr/bin/true"),
 1516:               DoFileExist("/bin/true"),
 1517:               %% Try which
 1518:               case filename:dirname(os:cmd("which true")) of
 1519:                   "." -> not_found;
 1520:                   TrueDir -> filename:join(TrueDir, "true")
 1521:               end
 1522:           end.
 1523: 
 1524: %% 'exit_status' option
 1525: %%
 1526: %% Test that the 'exit_status' option works
 1527: exit_status(Config)  when is_list(Config) ->
 1528:     ct:timetrap({minutes, 1}),
 1529:     port_expect(Config,
 1530:                 [{"x", [{exit_status, 5}]}],
 1531:                 1, "", [exit_status]),
 1532:     ok.
 1533: 
 1534: %% Test spawning a driver specifically
 1535: spawn_driver(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 1536:     Path = proplists:get_value(data_dir, Config),
 1537:     ok = load_driver(Path, "echo_drv"),
 1538:     Port = erlang:open_port({spawn_driver, "echo_drv"}, []),
 1539:     Port ! {self(), {command, "Hello port!"}},
 1540:     receive
 1541:         {Port, {data, "Hello port!"}} = Msg1 ->
 1542:             io:format("~p~n", [Msg1]),
 1543:             ok;
 1544:         Other ->
 1545:             ct:fail({unexpected, Other})
 1546:     end,
 1547:     Port ! {self(), close},
 1548:     receive {Port, closed} -> ok end,
 1549: 
 1550:     Port2 = erlang:open_port({spawn_driver, "echo_drv -Hello port?"},
 1551:                              []),
 1552:     receive
 1553:         {Port2, {data, "Hello port?"}} = Msg2 ->
 1554:             io:format("~p~n", [Msg2]),
 1555:             ok;
 1556:         Other2 ->
 1557:             ct:fail({unexpected2, Other2})
 1558:     end,
 1559:     Port2 ! {self(), close},
 1560:     receive {Port2, closed} -> ok end,
 1561:     {'EXIT',{badarg,_}} = (catch erlang:open_port({spawn_driver, "ls"}, [])),
 1562:     {'EXIT',{badarg,_}} = (catch erlang:open_port({spawn_driver, "cmd"}, [])),
 1563:     {'EXIT',{badarg,_}} = (catch erlang:open_port({spawn_driver, os:find_executable("erl")}, [])),
 1564:     ok.
 1565: 
 1566: %% Test parallelism option of open_port
 1567: parallelism_option(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 1568:     Path = proplists:get_value(data_dir, Config),
 1569:     ok = load_driver(Path, "echo_drv"),
 1570:     Port = erlang:open_port({spawn_driver, "echo_drv"},
 1571:                             [{parallelism, true}]),
 1572:     {parallelism, true} = erlang:port_info(Port, parallelism),
 1573:     Port ! {self(), {command, "Hello port!"}},
 1574:     receive
 1575:         {Port, {data, "Hello port!"}} = Msg1 ->
 1576:             io:format("~p~n", [Msg1]),
 1577:             ok;
 1578:         Other ->
 1579:             ct:fail({unexpected, Other})
 1580:     end,
 1581:     Port ! {self(), close},
 1582:     receive {Port, closed} -> ok end,
 1583: 
 1584:     Port2 = erlang:open_port({spawn_driver, "echo_drv -Hello port?"},
 1585:                              [{parallelism, false}]),
 1586:     {parallelism, false} = erlang:port_info(Port2, parallelism),
 1587:     receive
 1588:         {Port2, {data, "Hello port?"}} = Msg2 ->
 1589:             io:format("~p~n", [Msg2]),
 1590:             ok;
 1591:         Other2 ->
 1592:             ct:fail({unexpected2, Other2})
 1593:     end,
 1594:     Port2 ! {self(), close},
 1595:     receive {Port2, closed} -> ok end,
 1596:     ok.
 1597: 
 1598: %% Test spawning an executable specifically
 1599: spawn_executable(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 1600:     DataDir = proplists:get_value(data_dir, Config),
 1601:     EchoArgs1 = filename:join([DataDir,"echo_args"]),
 1602:     ExactFile1 = filename:nativename(os:find_executable(EchoArgs1)),
 1603:     [ExactFile1] = run_echo_args(DataDir,[]),
 1604:     [ExactFile1] = run_echo_args(DataDir,[binary]),
 1605:     ["echo_args"] = run_echo_args(DataDir,["echo_args"]),
 1606:     ["echo_args"] = run_echo_args(DataDir,[binary, "echo_args"]),
 1607:     ["echo_arguments"] = run_echo_args(DataDir,["echo_arguments"]),
 1608:     ["echo_arguments"] = run_echo_args(DataDir,[binary, "echo_arguments"]),
 1609:     [ExactFile1,"hello world","dlrow olleh"] =
 1610:     run_echo_args(DataDir,[ExactFile1,"hello world","dlrow olleh"]),
 1611:     [ExactFile1] = run_echo_args(DataDir,[default]),
 1612:     [ExactFile1] = run_echo_args(DataDir,[binary, default]),
 1613:     [ExactFile1,"hello world","dlrow olleh"] =
 1614:     run_echo_args(DataDir,[switch_order,ExactFile1,"hello world",
 1615:                            "dlrow olleh"]),
 1616:     [ExactFile1,"hello world","dlrow olleh"] =
 1617:     run_echo_args(DataDir,[binary,switch_order,ExactFile1,"hello world",
 1618:                            "dlrow olleh"]),
 1619:     [ExactFile1,"hello world","dlrow olleh"] =
 1620:     run_echo_args(DataDir,[default,"hello world","dlrow olleh"]),
 1621: 
 1622:     [ExactFile1,"hello world","dlrow olleh"] =
 1623:     run_echo_args_2("\""++ExactFile1++"\" "++"\"hello world\" \"dlrow olleh\""),
 1624:     [ExactFile1,"hello world","dlrow olleh"] =
 1625:     run_echo_args_2(unicode:characters_to_binary("\""++ExactFile1++"\" "++"\"hello world\" \"dlrow olleh\"")),
 1626: 
 1627:     PrivDir = proplists:get_value(priv_dir, Config),
 1628:     SpaceDir = filename:join([PrivDir,"With Spaces"]),
 1629:     file:make_dir(SpaceDir),
 1630:     Executable = filename:basename(ExactFile1),
 1631:     file:copy(ExactFile1,filename:join([SpaceDir,Executable])),
 1632:     ExactFile2 = filename:nativename(filename:join([SpaceDir,Executable])),
 1633:     chmodplusx(ExactFile2),
 1634:     io:format("|~s|~n",[ExactFile2]),
 1635:     [ExactFile2] = run_echo_args(SpaceDir,[]),
 1636:     ["echo_args"] = run_echo_args(SpaceDir,["echo_args"]),
 1637:     ["echo_arguments"] = run_echo_args(SpaceDir,["echo_arguments"]),
 1638:     [ExactFile2,"hello world","dlrow olleh"] =
 1639:     run_echo_args(SpaceDir,[ExactFile2,"hello world","dlrow olleh"]),
 1640:     [ExactFile2,"hello world","dlrow olleh"] =
 1641:     run_echo_args(SpaceDir,[binary, ExactFile2,"hello world","dlrow olleh"]),
 1642: 
 1643:     [ExactFile2,"hello \"world\"","\"dlrow\" olleh"] =
 1644:     run_echo_args(SpaceDir,[binary, ExactFile2,"hello \"world\"","\"dlrow\" olleh"]),
 1645:     [ExactFile2,"hello \"world\"","\"dlrow\" olleh"] =
 1646:     run_echo_args(SpaceDir,[binary, ExactFile2,"hello \"world\"","\"dlrow\" olleh"]),
 1647: 
 1648:     [ExactFile2] = run_echo_args(SpaceDir,[default]),
 1649:     [ExactFile2,"hello world","dlrow olleh"] =
 1650:     run_echo_args(SpaceDir,[switch_order,ExactFile2,"hello world", "dlrow olleh"]),
 1651:     [ExactFile2,"hello world","dlrow olleh"] =
 1652:     run_echo_args(SpaceDir,[default,"hello world","dlrow olleh"]),
 1653:     [ExactFile2,"hello world","dlrow olleh"] =
 1654:     run_echo_args_2("\""++ExactFile2++"\" "++"\"hello world\" \"dlrow olleh\""),
 1655:     [ExactFile2,"hello world","dlrow olleh"] =
 1656:     run_echo_args_2(unicode:characters_to_binary("\""++ExactFile2++"\" "++"\"hello world\" \"dlrow olleh\"")),
 1657: 
 1658:     ExeExt = filename:extension(ExactFile2),
 1659:     Executable2 = "spoky name"++ExeExt,
 1660:     file:copy(ExactFile1,filename:join([SpaceDir,Executable2])),
 1661:     ExactFile3 = filename:nativename(filename:join([SpaceDir,Executable2])),
 1662:     chmodplusx(ExactFile3),
 1663:     [ExactFile3] = run_echo_args(SpaceDir,Executable2,[]),
 1664:     ["echo_args"] = run_echo_args(SpaceDir,Executable2,["echo_args"]),
 1665:     ["echo_arguments"] = run_echo_args(SpaceDir,Executable2,["echo_arguments"]),
 1666:     [ExactFile3,"hello world","dlrow olleh"] =
 1667:     run_echo_args(SpaceDir,Executable2,[ExactFile3,"hello world","dlrow olleh"]),
 1668:     [ExactFile3] = run_echo_args(SpaceDir,Executable2,[default]),
 1669:     [ExactFile3,"hello world","dlrow olleh"] =
 1670:     run_echo_args(SpaceDir,Executable2,
 1671:                   [switch_order,ExactFile3,"hello world",
 1672:                    "dlrow olleh"]),
 1673:     [ExactFile3,"hello world","dlrow olleh"] =
 1674:     run_echo_args(SpaceDir,Executable2,
 1675:                   [default,"hello world","dlrow olleh"]),
 1676:     [ExactFile3,"hello world","dlrow olleh"] =
 1677:     run_echo_args_2("\""++ExactFile3++"\" "++"\"hello world\" \"dlrow olleh\""),
 1678:     [ExactFile3,"hello world","dlrow olleh"] =
 1679:     run_echo_args_2(unicode:characters_to_binary("\""++ExactFile3++"\" "++"\"hello world\" \"dlrow olleh\"")),
 1680:     {'EXIT',{enoent,_}} = (catch run_echo_args(SpaceDir,"fnurflmonfi",
 1681:                                                [default,"hello world",
 1682:                                                 "dlrow olleh"])),
 1683: 
 1684:     NonExec = "kronxfrt"++ExeExt,
 1685:     file:write_file(filename:join([SpaceDir,NonExec]),
 1686:                     <<"Not an executable">>),
 1687:     {'EXIT',{eacces,_}} = (catch run_echo_args(SpaceDir,NonExec,
 1688:                                                [default,"hello world",
 1689:                                                 "dlrow olleh"])),
 1690:     {'EXIT',{enoent,_}} = (catch open_port({spawn_executable,"cmd"},[])),
 1691:     {'EXIT',{enoent,_}} = (catch open_port({spawn_executable,"sh"},[])),
 1692:     case os:type() of
 1693:         {win32,_} ->
 1694:             test_bat_file(SpaceDir);
 1695:         {unix,_} ->
 1696:             test_sh_file(SpaceDir)
 1697:     end,
 1698:     ok.
 1699: 
 1700: unregister_name(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 1701:     Cmd = case os:getenv("WSLENV") of
 1702:               false -> "sleep 5";
 1703:               _ -> "wsl.exe sleep 5"
 1704:           end,
 1705:     true = register(crash, open_port({spawn, Cmd}, [])),
 1706:     true = unregister(crash).
 1707: 
 1708: test_bat_file(Dir) ->
 1709:     FN = "tf.bat",
 1710:     Full = filename:join([Dir,FN]),
 1711:     D = [<<"@echo off\r\n">>,
 1712:          <<"echo argv[0]:^|%0^|\r\n">>,
 1713:          <<"if \"%1\" == \"\" goto done\r\n">>,
 1714:          <<"echo argv[1]:^|%1^|\r\n">>,
 1715:          <<"if \"%2\" == \"\" goto done\r\n">>,
 1716:          <<"echo argv[2]:^|%2^|\r\n">>,
 1717:          <<"if \"%3\" == \"\" goto done\r\n">>,
 1718:          <<"echo argv[3]:^|%3^|\r\n">>,
 1719:          <<"if \"%4\" == \"\" goto done\r\n">>,
 1720:          <<"echo argv[4]:^|%4^|\r\n">>,
 1721:          <<"if \"%5\" == \"\" goto done\r\n">>,
 1722:          <<"echo argv[5]:^|%5^|\r\n">>,
 1723:          <<"\r\n">>,
 1724:          <<":done\r\n">>,
 1725:          <<"\r\n">>],
 1726:     file:write_file(Full,list_to_binary(D)),
 1727:     EF = filename:basename(FN),
 1728:     [DN,"hello","world"] =
 1729:     run_echo_args(Dir,FN,
 1730:                   [default,"hello","world"]),
 1731:     %% The arg0 argument should be ignored when running batch files
 1732:     [DN,"hello","world"] =
 1733:     run_echo_args(Dir,FN,
 1734:                   ["knaskurt","hello","world"]),
 1735:     EF = filename:basename(DN),
 1736:     ok.
 1737: 
 1738: test_sh_file(Dir) ->
 1739:     FN = "tf.sh",
 1740:     Full = filename:join([Dir,FN]),
 1741:     D = [<<"#! /bin/sh\n">>,
 1742:          <<"echo 'argv[0]:|'$0'|'\n">>,
 1743:          <<"i=1\n">>,
 1744:          <<"while [ '!' -z \"$1\" ]; do\n">>,
 1745:          <<"    echo 'argv['$i']:|'\"$1\"'|'\n">>,
 1746:          <<"    shift\n">>,
 1747:          <<"    i=`expr $i + 1`\n">>,
 1748:          <<"done\n">>],
 1749:     file:write_file(Full,list_to_binary(D)),
 1750:     chmodplusx(Full),
 1751:     [Full,"hello","world"] =
 1752:     run_echo_args(Dir,FN,
 1753:                   [default,"hello","world"]),
 1754:     [Full,"hello","world of spaces"] =
 1755:     run_echo_args(Dir,FN,
 1756:                   [default,"hello","world of spaces"]),
 1757:     file:write_file(filename:join([Dir,"testfile1"]),<<"testdata1">>),
 1758:     file:write_file(filename:join([Dir,"testfile2"]),<<"testdata2">>),
 1759:     Pattern = filename:join([Dir,"testfile*"]),
 1760:     L = filelib:wildcard(Pattern),
 1761:     2 = length(L),
 1762:     [Full,"hello",Pattern] =
 1763:     run_echo_args(Dir,FN,
 1764:                   [default,"hello",Pattern]),
 1765:     ok.
 1766: 
 1767: 
 1768: 
 1769: chmodplusx(Filename) ->
 1770:     case file:read_file_info(Filename) of
 1771:         {ok,FI} ->
 1772:             FI2 = FI#file_info{mode = ((FI#file_info.mode) bor 8#00100)},
 1773:             file:write_file_info(Filename,FI2);
 1774:         _ ->
 1775:             ok
 1776:     end.
 1777: 
 1778: run_echo_args_2(FullnameAndArgs) ->
 1779:     Port = open_port({spawn,FullnameAndArgs},[eof]),
 1780:     Data = collect_data(Port),
 1781:     Port ! {self(), close},
 1782:     receive {Port, closed} -> ok end,
 1783:     parse_echo_args_output(Data).
 1784: 
 1785: 
 1786: run_echo_args(Where,Args) ->
 1787:     run_echo_args(Where,"echo_args",Args).
 1788: run_echo_args(Where,Prog,Args) ->
 1789:     {Binary, ArgvArg} = pack_argv(Args),
 1790:     Command0 = filename:join([Where,Prog]),
 1791:     Command = case Binary of
 1792:                   true -> unicode:characters_to_binary(Command0);
 1793:                   false -> Command0
 1794:               end,
 1795:     Port = open_port({spawn_executable,Command},ArgvArg++[eof]),
 1796:     Data = collect_data(Port),
 1797:     Port ! {self(), close},
 1798:     receive {Port, closed} -> ok end,
 1799:     parse_echo_args_output(Data).
 1800: 
 1801: pack_argv([binary|Args]) ->
 1802:     {true, pack_argv(Args, true)};
 1803: pack_argv(Args) ->
 1804:     {false, pack_argv(Args, false)}.
 1805: 
 1806: pack_argv(Args, Binary) ->
 1807:     case Args of
 1808:         [] ->
 1809:             [];
 1810:         [default|T] ->
 1811:             [{args,[make_bin(Arg,Binary) || Arg <- T]}];
 1812:         [switch_order,H|T] ->
 1813:             [{args,[make_bin(Arg,Binary) || Arg <- T]},{arg0,make_bin(H,Binary)}];
 1814:         [H|T] ->
 1815:             [{arg0,make_bin(H,Binary)},{args,[make_bin(Arg,Binary) || Arg <- T]}]
 1816:     end.
 1817: 
 1818: make_bin(Str, false) -> Str;
 1819: make_bin(Str, true) ->  unicode:characters_to_binary(Str).
 1820: 
 1821: collect_data(Port) ->
 1822:     receive
 1823:         {Port, {data, Data}} ->
 1824:             Data ++ collect_data(Port);
 1825:         {Port, eof} ->
 1826:             []
 1827:     end.
 1828: 
 1829: parse_echo_args_output(Data) ->
 1830:     [lists:last(string:lexemes(S,"|")) || S <- string:lexemes(Data,["\r\n",$\n])].
 1831: 
 1832: %% Test that the emulator does not mix up ports when the port table wraps
 1833: mix_up_ports(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 1834:     Path = proplists:get_value(data_dir, Config),
 1835:     ok = load_driver(Path, "echo_drv"),
 1836:     Port = erlang:open_port({spawn, "echo_drv"}, []),
 1837:     Port ! {self(), {command, "Hello port!"}},
 1838:     receive
 1839:         {Port, {data, "Hello port!"}} = Msg1 ->
 1840:             io:format("~p~n", [Msg1]),
 1841:             ok;
 1842:         Other ->
 1843:             ct:fail({unexpected, Other})
 1844:     end,
 1845:     Port ! {self(), close},
 1846:     receive {Port, closed} -> ok end,
 1847:     loop(start, done,
 1848:          fun(P) ->
 1849:                  Q =
 1850:                  (catch erlang:open_port({spawn, "echo_drv"}, [])),
 1851:                  %%		       io:format("~p ", [Q]),
 1852:                  if is_port(Q) ->
 1853:                         Q;
 1854:                     true ->
 1855:                         io:format("~p~n", [P]),
 1856:                         done
 1857:                  end
 1858:          end),
 1859:     Port ! {self(), {command, "Hello again port!"}},
 1860:     receive
 1861:         Msg2 ->
 1862:             ct:fail({unexpected, Msg2})
 1863:     after 1000 ->
 1864:               ok
 1865:     end,
 1866:     ok.
 1867: 
 1868: loop(Stop, Stop, Fun) when is_function(Fun) ->
 1869:     ok;
 1870: loop(Start, Stop, Fun) when is_function(Fun) ->
 1871:     loop(Fun(Start), Stop, Fun).
 1872: 
 1873: 
 1874: %% Test that link to connected process is taken away when port calls
 1875: %% driver_exit() also when the port index has wrapped
 1876: otp_5112(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 1877:     Path = proplists:get_value(data_dir, Config),
 1878:     ok = load_driver(Path, "exit_drv"),
 1879:     Port = otp_5112_get_wrapped_port(),
 1880:     io:format("Max ports: ~p~n",[max_ports()]),
 1881:     io:format("Port: ~p~n",[Port]),
 1882:     {links, Links1} = process_info(self(),links),
 1883:     io:format("Links1: ~p~n",[Links1]),
 1884:     true = lists:member(Port, Links1),
 1885:     Port ! {self(), {command, ""}},
 1886:     wait_until(fun () -> lists:member(Port, erlang:ports()) == false end),
 1887:     receive after 1000 -> ok end, %% Give signal some time to propagate...
 1888:     {links, Links2} = process_info(self(),links),
 1889:     io:format("Links2: ~p~n",[Links2]),
 1890:     false = lists:member(Port, Links2), %% This used to fail
 1891:     ok.
 1892: 
 1893: otp_5112_get_wrapped_port() ->
 1894:     P1 = erlang:open_port({spawn, "exit_drv"}, []),
 1895:     case port_ix(P1) < max_ports() of
 1896:         true ->
 1897:             io:format("Need to wrap port index (~p)~n", [P1]),
 1898:             otp_5112_wrap_port_ix([P1]),
 1899:             P2 = erlang:open_port({spawn, "exit_drv"}, []),
 1900:             false = port_ix(P2) < max_ports(),
 1901:             P2;
 1902:         false ->
 1903:             io:format("Port index already wrapped (~p)~n", [P1]),
 1904:             P1
 1905:     end.
 1906: 
 1907: otp_5112_wrap_port_ix(Ports) ->
 1908:     case (catch erlang:open_port({spawn, "exit_drv"}, [])) of
 1909:         Port when is_port(Port) ->
 1910:             otp_5112_wrap_port_ix([Port|Ports]);
 1911:         _ ->
 1912:             %% Port table now full; empty port table
 1913:             lists:foreach(fun (P) ->  P ! {self(), close} end,
 1914:                           Ports),
 1915:             ok
 1916:     end.
 1917: 
 1918: 
 1919: %% Test that port index is not unnecessarily wrapped
 1920: otp_5119(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 1921:     Path = proplists:get_value(data_dir, Config),
 1922:     ok = load_driver(Path, "exit_drv"),
 1923:     PI1 = port_ix(otp_5119_fill_empty_port_tab([])),
 1924:     Port2 = erlang:open_port({spawn, "exit_drv"}, []),
 1925:     PI2 = port_ix(Port2),
 1926:     {PortIx1, PortIx2} = case PI2 > PI1 of
 1927:                              true ->
 1928:                                  {PI1, PI2};
 1929:                              false ->
 1930:                                  {port_ix(otp_5119_fill_empty_port_tab([Port2])),
 1931:                                   port_ix(erlang:open_port({spawn, "exit_drv"}, []))}
 1932:                          end,
 1933:     MaxPorts = max_ports(),
 1934:     io:format("PortIx1 = ~p ~p~n", [PI1, PortIx1]),
 1935:     io:format("PortIx2 = ~p ~p~n", [PI2, PortIx2]),
 1936:     io:format("MaxPorts = ~p~n", [MaxPorts]),
 1937:     true = PortIx2 > PortIx1,
 1938:     true = PortIx2 =< PortIx1 + MaxPorts,
 1939:     ok.
 1940: 
 1941: otp_5119_fill_empty_port_tab(Ports) ->
 1942:     case (catch erlang:open_port({spawn, "exit_drv"}, [])) of
 1943:         Port when is_port(Port) ->
 1944:             otp_5119_fill_empty_port_tab([Port|Ports]);
 1945:         _ ->
 1946:             %% Port table now full; empty port table
 1947:             lists:foreach(fun (P) ->  P ! {self(), close} end,
 1948:                           Ports),
 1949:             [LastPort|_] = Ports,
 1950:             LastPort
 1951:     end.
 1952: 
 1953: max_ports() ->
 1954:     erlang:system_info(port_limit).
 1955: 
 1956: port_ix(Port) when is_port(Port) ->
 1957:     ["#Port",_,PortIxStr] = string:lexemes(erlang:port_to_list(Port),
 1958:                                           "<.>"),
 1959:     list_to_integer(PortIxStr).
 1960: 
 1961: 
 1962: %% Check that port command failure doesn't crash the emulator
 1963: otp_6224(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 1964:     Path = proplists:get_value(data_dir, Config),
 1965:     ok = load_driver(Path, "failure_drv"),
 1966:     Go = make_ref(),
 1967:     Failer = spawn(fun () ->
 1968:                            receive Go -> ok end,
 1969:                            Port = open_port({spawn, "failure_drv"},
 1970:                                             []),
 1971:                            Port ! {self(), {command, "Fail, please!"}},
 1972:                            otp_6224_loop()
 1973:                    end),
 1974:     Mon = erlang:monitor(process, Failer),
 1975:     Failer ! Go,
 1976:     receive
 1977:         {'DOWN', Mon, process, Failer, Reason} ->
 1978:             case Reason of
 1979:                 {driver_failed, _} -> ok;
 1980:                 driver_failed -> ok;
 1981:                 _ -> ct:fail({unexpected_exit_reason,
 1982:                               Reason})
 1983:             end
 1984:     end,
 1985:     ok.
 1986: 
 1987: otp_6224_loop() ->
 1988:     receive _ -> ok after 0 -> ok end,
 1989:     otp_6224_loop().
 1990: 
 1991: 
 1992: -define(EXIT_STATUS_MSB_MAX_PROCS, 64).
 1993: -define(EXIT_STATUS_MSB_MAX_PORTS, 300).
 1994: 
 1995: exit_status_multi_scheduling_block(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 1996:     Repeat = 3,
 1997:     case os:type() of
 1998:         {unix, _} ->
 1999:             ct:timetrap({minutes, 2*Repeat}),
 2000:             SleepSecs = 6,
 2001:             try
 2002:                 lists:foreach(fun (_) ->
 2003:                                       exit_status_msb_test(Config,
 2004:                                                            SleepSecs)
 2005:                               end,
 2006:                               lists:seq(1, Repeat))
 2007:             after
 2008:                 %% Wait for the system to recover (regardless
 2009:                 %% of success or not) otherwise later testcases
 2010:                 %% may unnecessarily fail.
 2011:                 receive after SleepSecs+500 -> ok end
 2012:             end;
 2013:         _ -> {skip, "Not implemented for this OS"}
 2014:     end.
 2015: 
 2016: exit_status_msb_test(Config, SleepSecs) when is_list(Config) ->
 2017:     %%
 2018:     %% We want to start port programs from as many schedulers as possible
