 2019:     %% and we want these port programs to terminate while multi-scheduling
 2020:     %% is blocked.
 2021:     %%
 2022:     NoSchedsOnln = erlang:system_info(schedulers_online),
 2023:     Parent = self(),
 2024:     io:format("SleepSecs = ~p~n", [SleepSecs]),
 2025:     PortProg = "sleep " ++ integer_to_list(SleepSecs),
 2026:     Start = erlang:monotonic_time(microsecond),
 2027:     NoProcs = case NoSchedsOnln of
 2028:                   NProcs when NProcs < ?EXIT_STATUS_MSB_MAX_PROCS ->
 2029:                       NProcs;
 2030:                   _ ->
 2031:                       ?EXIT_STATUS_MSB_MAX_PROCS
 2032:               end,
 2033:     NoPortsPerProc = case 20*NoProcs of
 2034:                          TNPorts when TNPorts < ?EXIT_STATUS_MSB_MAX_PORTS -> 20;
 2035:                          _ -> ?EXIT_STATUS_MSB_MAX_PORTS div NoProcs
 2036:                      end,
 2037:     io:format("NoProcs = ~p~nNoPortsPerProc = ~p~n",
 2038:               [NoProcs, NoPortsPerProc]),
 2039:     ProcFun
 2040:     = fun () ->
 2041:               PrtSIds = lists:map(
 2042:                           fun (_) ->
 2043:                                   erlang:yield(),
 2044:                                   case catch open_port({spawn, PortProg},
 2045:                                                        [exit_status]) of
 2046:                                       Prt when is_port(Prt) ->
 2047:                                           {Prt,
 2048:                                            erlang:system_info(scheduler_id)};
 2049:                                       {'EXIT', {Err, _}} when Err == eagain;
 2050:                                                               Err == emfile;
 2051:                                                               Err == enomem ->
 2052:                                           noop;
 2053:                                       {'EXIT', Err} when Err == eagain;
 2054:                                                          Err == emfile;
 2055:                                                          Err == enomem ->
 2056:                                           noop;
 2057:                                       Error ->
 2058:                                           ct:fail(Error)
 2059:                                   end
 2060:                           end,
 2061:                           lists:seq(1, NoPortsPerProc)),
 2062:               SIds = lists:filter(fun (noop) -> false;
 2063:                                       (_) -> true
 2064:                                   end,
 2065:                                   lists:map(fun (noop) -> noop;
 2066:                                                 ({_, SId}) -> SId
 2067:                                             end,
 2068:                                             PrtSIds)),
 2069:               process_flag(scheduler, 0),
 2070:               Parent ! {self(), started, SIds},
 2071:               lists:foreach(
 2072:                 fun (noop) ->
 2073:                         noop;
 2074:                     ({Port, _}) ->
 2075:                         receive
 2076:                             {Port, {exit_status, 0}} ->
 2077:                                 ok;
 2078:                             {Port, {exit_status, Status}} when Status > 128 ->
 2079:                                 %% Sometimes happens when we have created
 2080:                                 %% too many ports.
 2081:                                 ok;
 2082:                             {Port, {exit_status, _}} = ESMsg ->
 2083:                                 {Port, {exit_status, 0}} = ESMsg
 2084:                         end
 2085:                 end,
 2086:                 PrtSIds),
 2087:               Parent ! {self(), done}
 2088:       end,
 2089:     Procs = lists:map(fun (N) ->
 2090:                               spawn_opt(ProcFun,
 2091:                                         [link,
 2092:                                          {scheduler,
 2093:                                           (N rem NoSchedsOnln)+1}])
 2094:                       end,
 2095:                       lists:seq(1, NoProcs)),
 2096:     SIds = lists:map(fun (P) ->
 2097:                              receive {P, started, SIds} -> SIds end
 2098:                      end,
 2099:                      Procs),
 2100:     StartedTime = (erlang:monotonic_time(microsecond) - Start)/1000000,
 2101:     io:format("StartedTime = ~p~n", [StartedTime]),
 2102:     true = StartedTime < SleepSecs,
 2103:     erlang:system_flag(multi_scheduling, block_normal),
 2104:     lists:foreach(fun (P) -> receive {P, done} -> ok end end, Procs),
 2105:     DoneTime = (erlang:monotonic_time(microsecond) - Start)/1000000,
 2106:     io:format("DoneTime = ~p~n", [DoneTime]),
 2107:     true = DoneTime > SleepSecs,
 2108:     ok = verify_multi_scheduling_blocked(),
 2109:     erlang:system_flag(multi_scheduling, unblock_normal),
 2110:     case {length(lists:usort(lists:flatten(SIds))), NoSchedsOnln} of
 2111:         {N, N} ->
 2112:             ok;
 2113:         {N, M} ->
 2114:             ct:fail("Failed to create ports on all ~w available"
 2115:                     "schedulers. Only created ports on ~w schedulers.", [M, N])
 2116:     end.
 2117: 
 2118: save_sid(SIds) ->
 2119:     SId = erlang:system_info(scheduler_id),
 2120:     case lists:member(SId, SIds) of
 2121:         true -> SIds;
 2122:         false -> [SId|SIds]
 2123:     end.
 2124: 
 2125: sid_proc(SIds) ->
 2126:     NewSIds = save_sid(SIds),
 2127:     receive
 2128:         {From, want_sids} ->
 2129:             From ! {self(), sids, NewSIds}
 2130:     after 0 ->
 2131:               sid_proc(NewSIds)
 2132:     end.
 2133: 
 2134: verify_multi_scheduling_blocked() ->
 2135:     Procs = lists:map(fun (_) ->
 2136:                               spawn_link(fun () -> sid_proc([]) end)
 2137:                       end,
 2138:                       lists:seq(1, 3*erlang:system_info(schedulers_online))),
 2139:     receive after 1000 -> ok end,
 2140:     SIds = lists:map(fun (P) ->
 2141:                              P ! {self(), want_sids},
 2142:                              receive {P, sids, PSIds} -> PSIds end
 2143:                      end,
 2144:                      Procs),
 2145:     1 = length(lists:usort(lists:flatten(SIds))),
 2146:     ok.
 2147: 
 2148: 
 2149: %%% Pinging functions.
 2150: 
 2151: stream_ping(Config, Size, CmdLine, Options) ->
 2152:     Data = random_packet(Size),
 2153:     port_expect(Config, [{Data, [Data]}], 0, CmdLine, Options).
 2154: 
 2155: ping(Config, Sizes, HSize, CmdLine, Options) ->
 2156:     Actions = lists:map(fun(Size) ->
 2157:                                 [$p|Packet] = random_packet(Size, "ping"),
 2158:                                 {[$p|Packet], [[$P|Packet]]}
 2159:                         end,
 2160:                         Sizes),
 2161:     port_expect(Config, Actions, HSize, CmdLine, Options).
 2162: 
 2163: %% expect_input(Sizes, HSize, CmdLine, Options)
 2164: %%
 2165: %% Sizes = Size of packets to generated.
 2166: %% HSize = Header size: 1, 2, or 4
 2167: %% CmdLine = Additional command line options.
 2168: %% Options = Additional port options.
 2169: 
 2170: expect_input(Config, Sizes, HSize, CmdLine, Options) ->
 2171:     expect_input1(Config, Sizes, {HSize, CmdLine, Options}, [], []).
 2172: 
 2173: expect_input1(Config, [0|Rest], Params, Expect, ReplyCommand) ->
 2174:     expect_input1(Config, Rest, Params, [""|Expect], ["x0"|ReplyCommand]);
 2175: expect_input1(Config, [Size|Rest], Params, Expect, ReplyCommand) ->
 2176:     Packet = random_packet(Size),
 2177:     Fmt = io_lib:format("~c~p", [hd(Packet), Size]),
 2178:     expect_input1(Config, Rest, Params, [Packet|Expect], [Fmt|ReplyCommand]);
 2179: expect_input1(Config, [], {HSize, CmdLine0, Options}, Expect, ReplyCommand) ->
 2180:     CmdLine = build_cmd_line(CmdLine0, ReplyCommand, []),
 2181:     port_expect(Config, [{false, lists:reverse(Expect)}],
 2182:                 HSize, CmdLine, Options).
 2183: 
 2184: build_cmd_line(FixedCmdLine, [Cmd|Rest], []) ->
 2185:     build_cmd_line(FixedCmdLine, Rest, [Cmd]);
 2186: build_cmd_line(FixedCmdLine, [Cmd|Rest], Result) ->
 2187:     build_cmd_line(FixedCmdLine, Rest, [Cmd, $:|Result]);
 2188: build_cmd_line(FixedCmdLine, [], Result) ->
 2189:     lists:flatten([FixedCmdLine, " -r", Result, " -n"]).
 2190: 
 2191: %% port_expect(Actions, HSize, CmdLine, Options)
 2192: %%
 2193: %% Actions = [{Send, ExpectList}|Rest]
 2194: %% HSize = 0 (stream), or 1, 2, 4   (header size aka "packet bytes")
 2195: %% CmdLine = Command line for port_test.  Don't include -h<digit>.
 2196: %% Options = Options for open_port/2.  Don't include {packet, Number} or
 2197: %%           or stream.
 2198: %%
 2199: %% Send = false | list()
 2200: %% ExpectList = List of lists or binaries.
 2201: %%
 2202: %% Returns the port.
 2203: 
 2204: port_expect(Config, Actions, HSize, CmdLine, Options0) ->
 2205:     %    io:format("port_expect(~p, ~p, ~p, ~p)",
 2206:     %		[Actions, HSize, CmdLine, Options0]),
 2207:     PortTest = port_test(Config),
 2208:     Cmd = lists:concat([PortTest, " -h", HSize, " ", CmdLine]),
 2209:     PortType =
 2210:     case HSize of
 2211:         0 -> stream;
 2212:         _ -> {packet, HSize}
 2213:     end,
 2214:     Options = [PortType|Options0],
 2215:     ct:log("open_port({spawn, ~p}, ~p)", [Cmd, Options]),
 2216:     Port = open_port({spawn, Cmd}, Options),
 2217:     port_expect(Port, Actions, Options),
 2218:     Port.
 2219: 
 2220: port_expect(Port, [{Send, Expects}|Rest], Options) when is_list(Expects) ->
 2221:     port_send(Port, Send),
 2222:     IsBinaryPort = lists:member(binary, Options),
 2223:     Receiver =
 2224:     case {lists:member(stream, Options), line_option(Options)} of
 2225:         {false, _} -> fun receive_all/2;
 2226:         {true,false}  -> fun stream_receive_all/2;
 2227:         {_, true} -> fun receive_all/2
 2228:     end,
 2229:     Receiver(Port, maybe_to_binary(Expects, IsBinaryPort)),
 2230:     port_expect(Port, Rest, Options);
 2231: port_expect(_, [], _) ->
 2232:     ok.
 2233: 
 2234: %%% Check for either line or {line,N} in option list
 2235: line_option([{line,_}|_]) ->
 2236:     true;
 2237: line_option([line|_]) ->
 2238:     true;
 2239: line_option([_|T]) ->
 2240:     line_option(T);
 2241: line_option([]) ->
 2242:     false.
 2243: 
 2244: any_list_to_binary({Atom, List}) ->
 2245:     {Atom, list_to_binary(List)};
 2246: any_list_to_binary(List) ->
 2247:     list_to_binary(List).
 2248: 
 2249: maybe_to_binary(Expects, true) ->
 2250:     lists:map(fun any_list_to_binary/1, Expects);
 2251: maybe_to_binary(Expects, false) ->
 2252:     Expects.
 2253: 
 2254: port_send(_Port, false) -> ok;
 2255: port_send(Port, Send) when is_list(Send) ->
 2256:     %    io:format("port_send(~p, ~p)", [Port, Send]),
 2257:     Port ! {self(), {command, Send}}.
 2258: 
 2259: receive_all(Port, [Expect|Rest]) ->
 2260:     %    io:format("receive_all(~p, [~p|Rest])", [Port, Expect]),
 2261:     receive
 2262:         {Port, {data, Expect}} ->
 2263:             io:format("Received ~s", [format(Expect)]),
 2264:             ok;
 2265:         {Port, {data, Other}} ->
 2266:             io:format("Received ~s; expected ~s",
 2267:                       [format(Other), format(Expect)]),
 2268:             ct:fail(bad_message);
 2269:         Other ->
 2270:             %% (We're not yet prepared for receiving both 'eol' and
 2271:             %% 'exit_status'; remember that they may appear in any order.)
 2272:             case {Expect, Rest, Other} of
 2273:                 {eof, [], {Port, eof}} ->
 2274:                     io:format("Received soft EOF.",[]),
 2275:                     ok;
 2276:                 {{exit_status, S}, [], {Port, {exit_status, S}}} ->
 2277:                     io:format("Received exit status ~p.",[S]),
 2278:                     ok;
 2279:                 _ ->
 2280:                     %%%	            io:format("Unexpected message: ~s", [format(Other)]),
 2281:                     io:format("Unexpected message: ~w", [Other]),
 2282:                     ct:fail(unexpected_message)
 2283:             end
 2284:     end,
 2285:     receive_all(Port, Rest);
 2286: receive_all(_Port, []) ->
 2287:     ok.
 2288: 
 2289: stream_receive_all(Port, [Expect]) ->
 2290:     stream_receive_all1(Port, Expect).
 2291: 
 2292: stream_receive_all1(_Port, Empty) when is_binary(Empty), size(Empty) == 0 ->
 2293:     ok;
 2294: stream_receive_all1(_Port, []) ->
 2295:     ok;
 2296: stream_receive_all1(Port, Expect) ->
 2297:     receive
 2298:         {Port, {data, Data}} ->
 2299:             Remaining = compare(Data, Expect),
 2300:             stream_receive_all1(Port, Remaining);
 2301:         Other ->
 2302:             ct:fail({bad_message, Other})
 2303:     end.
 2304: 
 2305: compare(B1, B2) when is_binary(B1), is_binary(B2), byte_size(B1) =< byte_size(B2) ->
 2306:     case split_binary(B2, size(B1)) of
 2307:         {B1,Remaining} ->
 2308:             Remaining;
 2309:         _Other ->
 2310:             ct:fail(nomatch)
 2311:     end;
 2312: compare(B1, B2) when is_binary(B1), is_binary(B2) ->
 2313:     ct:fail(too_much_data);
 2314: compare([X|Rest1], [X|Rest2]) ->
 2315:     compare(Rest1, Rest2);
 2316: compare([_|_], [_|_]) ->
 2317:     ct:fail(nomatch);
 2318: compare([], Remaining) ->
 2319:     Remaining;
 2320: compare(_Data, []) ->
 2321:     ct:fail(too_much_data).
 2322: 
 2323: maybe_to_list(Bin) when is_binary(Bin) ->
 2324:     binary_to_list(Bin);
 2325: maybe_to_list(List) ->
 2326:     List.
 2327: 
 2328: format({Eol,List}) ->
 2329:     io_lib:format("tuple<~w,~w>",[Eol, maybe_to_list(List)]);
 2330: format(List) when is_list(List) ->
 2331:     case list_at_least(50, List) of
 2332:         true ->
 2333:             io_lib:format("\"~-50s...\"", [List]);
 2334:         false ->
 2335:             io_lib:format("~p", [List])
 2336:     end;
 2337: format(Bin) when is_binary(Bin), size(Bin) >= 50 ->
 2338:     io_lib:format("binary<~-50s...>", [binary_to_list(Bin, 1, 50)]);
 2339: format(Bin) when is_binary(Bin) ->
 2340:     io_lib:format("binary<~s>", [binary_to_list(Bin)]).
 2341: 
 2342: 
 2343: list_at_least(Number, [_|Rest]) when Number > 0 ->
 2344:     list_at_least(Number-1, Rest);
 2345: list_at_least(Number, []) when Number > 0 ->
 2346:     false;
 2347: list_at_least(0, _List) -> true.
 2348: 
 2349: 
 2350: %%% Utility functions.
 2351: 
 2352: random_packet(Size) ->
 2353:     random_packet(Size, "").
 2354: 
 2355: random_packet(Size, Prefix) ->
 2356:     build_packet(Size-length(Prefix), lists:reverse(Prefix), random_char()).
 2357: 
 2358: build_packet(0, Result, _NextChar) ->
 2359:     lists:reverse(Result);
 2360: build_packet(Left, Result, NextChar0) ->
 2361:     NextChar =
 2362:     if
 2363:         NextChar0 >= 126 ->
 2364:             33;
 2365:         true ->
 2366:             NextChar0+1
 2367:     end,
 2368:     build_packet(Left-1, [NextChar0|Result], NextChar).
 2369: 
 2370: sizes() ->
 2371:     [10, 13, 64, 127, 128, 255, 256, 1023, 1024,
 2372:      32767, 32768, 65535, 65536].
 2373: 
 2374: sizes(Header_Size) ->
 2375:     sizes(Header_Size, sizes(), []).
 2376: 
 2377: sizes(1, [Packet_Size|Rest], Result) when Packet_Size < 256 ->
 2378:     sizes(1, Rest, [Packet_Size|Result]);
 2379: sizes(2, [Packet_Size|Rest], Result) when Packet_Size < 65536 ->
 2380:     sizes(2, Rest, [Packet_Size|Result]);
 2381: sizes(4, [Packet_Size|Rest], Result) ->
 2382:     sizes(4, Rest, [Packet_Size|Result]);
 2383: sizes(_, _, Result) ->
 2384:     Result.
 2385: 
 2386: random_char() ->
 2387:     random_char("abcdefghijklmnopqrstuvxyzABCDEFGHIJKLMNOPQRSTUVXYZ0123456789").
 2388: 
 2389: random_char(Chars) ->
 2390:     lists:nth(uniform(length(Chars)), Chars).
 2391: 
 2392: uniform(N) ->
 2393:     case rand:export_seed() of
 2394:         undefined ->
 2395:             rand:seed(exsplus),
 2396:             io:format("Random seed = ~p\n", [rand:export_seed()]);
 2397:         _ ->
 2398:             ok
 2399:     end,
 2400:     rand:uniform(N).
 2401: 
 2402: fun_spawn(Fun) ->
 2403:     fun_spawn(Fun, []).
 2404: 
 2405: fun_spawn(Fun, Args) ->
 2406:     spawn_link(erlang, apply, [Fun, Args]).
 2407: 
 2408: port_test(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 2409:     filename:join(proplists:get_value(data_dir, Config), "port_test").
 2410: 
 2411: %% Test that erlang:ports/0 returns a consistent snapshot of ports
 2412: ports(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 2413:     Path = proplists:get_value(data_dir, Config),
 2414:     ok = load_driver(Path, "exit_drv"),
 2415: 
 2416:     receive after 1000 -> ok end, % Wait for other ports to stabilize
 2417: 
 2418:     OtherPorts = erlang:ports(),
 2419:     io:format("Other ports: ~p\n",[OtherPorts]),
 2420:     MaxPorts = 1024 - length(OtherPorts),
 2421: 
 2422:     TrafficPid = spawn_link(fun() -> ports_traffic(MaxPorts) end),
 2423: 
 2424:     ports_snapshots(100, TrafficPid, OtherPorts),
 2425:     TrafficPid ! {self(),die},
 2426:     receive {TrafficPid, dead} -> ok end,
 2427:     ok.
 2428: 
 2429: ports_snapshots(0, _, _) ->
 2430:     ok;
 2431: ports_snapshots(Iter, TrafficPid, OtherPorts) ->
 2432: 
 2433:     TrafficPid ! start,
 2434:     receive after 1 -> ok end,
 2435: 
 2436:     Snapshot = erlang:ports(),
 2437: 
 2438:     TrafficPid ! {self(), stop},
 2439:     receive {TrafficPid, EventList, TrafficPorts} -> ok end,
 2440: 
 2441:     %%io:format("Snapshot=~p\n", [Snapshot]),
 2442:     ports_verify(Snapshot, OtherPorts ++ TrafficPorts, EventList),
 2443: 
 2444:     ports_snapshots(Iter-1, TrafficPid, OtherPorts).
 2445: 
 2446: 
 2447: ports_traffic(MaxPorts) ->
 2448:     ports_traffic_stopped(MaxPorts, {[],0}).
 2449: 
 2450: ports_traffic_stopped(MaxPorts, {PortList, PortCnt}) ->
 2451:     receive
 2452:         start ->
 2453:             %%io:format("Traffic started in ~p\n",[self()]),
 2454:             ports_traffic_started(MaxPorts, {PortList, PortCnt}, []);
 2455:         {Pid,die} ->
 2456:             lists:foreach(fun(Port)-> erlang:port_close(Port) end,
 2457:                           PortList),
 2458:             Pid ! {self(),dead}
 2459:     end.
 2460: 
 2461: ports_traffic_started(MaxPorts, {PortList, PortCnt}, EventList) ->
 2462:     receive
 2463:         {Pid, stop} ->
 2464:             %%io:format("Traffic stopped in ~p\n",[self()]),
 2465:             Pid ! {self(), EventList, PortList},
 2466:             ports_traffic_stopped(MaxPorts, {PortList, PortCnt})
 2467: 
 2468:     after 0 ->
 2469:               ports_traffic_do(MaxPorts, {PortList, PortCnt}, EventList)
 2470:     end.
 2471: 
 2472: ports_traffic_do(MaxPorts, {PortList, PortCnt}, EventList) ->
 2473:     N = uniform(MaxPorts),
 2474:     case N > PortCnt of
 2475:         true -> % Open port
 2476:             P = open_port({spawn, "exit_drv"}, []),
 2477:             %%io:format("Created port ~p\n",[P]),
 2478:             ports_traffic_started(MaxPorts, {[P|PortList], PortCnt+1},
 2479:                                   [{open,P}|EventList]);
 2480: 
 2481:         false -> % Close port
 2482:             P = lists:nth(N, PortList),
 2483:             %%io:format("Close port ~p\n",[P]),
 2484:             true = erlang:port_close(P),
 2485:             ports_traffic_started(MaxPorts, {lists:delete(P,PortList), PortCnt-1},
 2486:                                   [{close,P}|EventList])
 2487:     end.
 2488: 
 2489: ports_verify(Ports, PortsAfter, EventList) ->
 2490:     %%io:format("Candidate=~p\nEvents=~p\n", [PortsAfter, EventList]),
 2491:     case lists:sort(Ports) =:= lists:sort(PortsAfter) of
 2492:         true ->
 2493:             io:format("Snapshot of ~p ports verified ok.\n",[length(Ports)]),
 2494:             ok;
 2495:         false ->
 2496:             %% Note that we track the event list "backwards", undoing open/close:
 2497:             case EventList of
 2498:                 [{open,P} | Tail] ->
 2499:                     ports_verify(Ports, lists:delete(P,PortsAfter), Tail);
 2500: 
 2501:                 [{close,P} | Tail] ->
 2502:                     ports_verify(Ports, [P | PortsAfter], Tail);
 2503: 
 2504:                 [] ->
 2505:                     ct:fail("Inconsistent snapshot from erlang:ports()")
 2506:             end
 2507:     end.
 2508: 
 2509: load_driver(Dir, Driver) ->
 2510:     case erl_ddll:load_driver(Dir, Driver) of
 2511:         ok -> ok;
 2512:         {error, Error} = Res ->
 2513:             io:format("~s\n", [erl_ddll:format_error(Error)]),
 2514:             Res
 2515:     end.
 2516: 
 2517: 
 2518: %% Send data to port program that does not read it, then close port.
 2519: %% Primary targeting Windows to test threaded_handle_closer in sys.c
 2520: close_deaf_port(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 2521:     ct:timetrap({minutes, 2}),
 2522:     DataDir = proplists:get_value(data_dir, Config),
 2523:     DeadPort = os:find_executable("dead_port", DataDir),
 2524:     Port = open_port({spawn, DeadPort++" 60"},[]),
 2525:     erlang:port_command(Port,"Hello, can you hear me!?!?"),
 2526:     port_close(Port),
 2527: 
 2528:     Res = close_deaf_port_1(0, DeadPort),
 2529:     io:format("Waiting for OS procs to terminate...\n"),
 2530:     receive after 5*1000 -> ok end,
 2531:     Res.
 2532: 
 2533: close_deaf_port_1(200, _) ->
 2534:     ok;
 2535: close_deaf_port_1(N, Cmd) ->
 2536:     Timeout = integer_to_list(rand:uniform(5*1000)),
 2537:     try open_port({spawn_executable,Cmd},[{args,[Timeout]}]) of
 2538:         Port ->
 2539:             erlang:port_command(Port,"Hello, can you hear me!?!?"),
 2540:             port_close(Port),
 2541:             close_deaf_port_1(N+1, Cmd)
 2542:     catch
 2543:         _:eagain ->
 2544:             {comment, "Could not spawn more than " ++ integer_to_list(N) ++ " OS processes."}
 2545:     end.
 2546: 
 2547: %% Test undocumented port_set_data/2 and port_get_data/1
 2548: %% Hammer from multiple processes a while
 2549: %% and then abrubtly close the port (OTP-12208).
 2550: port_setget_data(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 2551:     ok = load_driver(proplists:get_value(data_dir, Config), "echo_drv"),
 2552:     Port = erlang:open_port({spawn_driver, "echo_drv"}, []),
 2553: 
 2554:     NSched = erlang:system_info(schedulers_online),
 2555:     HeapData = {1,2,3,<<"A heap binary">>,fun()->"This is fun"end,
 2556:                 list_to_binary(lists:seq(1,100))},
 2557:     PRs = lists:map(fun(I) ->
 2558:                             spawn_opt(fun() -> port_setget_data_hammer(Port,HeapData,false,1) end,
 2559:                                       [monitor, {scheduler, I rem NSched}])
 2560:                     end,
 2561:                     lists:seq(1,10)),
 2562:     receive after 100 -> ok end,
 2563:     Papa = self(),
 2564:     lists:foreach(fun({Pid,_}) -> Pid ! {Papa,prepare_for_close} end, PRs),
 2565:     lists:foreach(fun({Pid,_}) ->
 2566:                           receive {Pid,prepare_for_close} -> ok end
 2567:                   end,
 2568:                   PRs),
 2569:     port_close(Port),
 2570:     lists:foreach(fun({Pid,Ref}) ->
 2571:                           receive {'DOWN', Ref, process, Pid, normal} -> ok end
 2572:                   end,
 2573:                   PRs),
 2574:     ok.
 2575: 
 2576: port_setget_data_hammer(Port, HeapData, IsSet0, N) ->
 2577:     Rand = rand:uniform(3),
 2578:     IsSet1 = try case Rand of
 2579:                      1 -> true = erlang:port_set_data(Port, atom), true;
 2580:                      2 -> true = erlang:port_set_data(Port, HeapData), true;
 2581:                      3 -> case erlang:port_get_data(Port) of
 2582:                               atom -> true;
 2583:                               HeapData -> true;
 2584:                               undefined -> false=IsSet0
 2585:                           end
 2586:                  end
 2587:              catch
 2588:                  error:badarg ->
 2589:                      true = get(prepare_for_close),
 2590:                      io:format("~p did ~p rounds before port closed\n", [self(), N]),
 2591:                      exit(normal)
 2592:              end,
 2593:     receive {Papa, prepare_for_close} ->
 2594:                 put(prepare_for_close, true),
 2595:                 Papa ! {self(),prepare_for_close}
 2596:     after 0 ->
 2597:               ok
 2598:     end,
 2599:     port_setget_data_hammer(Port, HeapData, IsSet1, N+1).
 2600: 
 2601: 
 2602: wait_until(Fun) ->
 2603:     case catch Fun() of
 2604:         true ->
 2605:             ok;
 2606:         _ ->
 2607:             receive after 100 -> ok end,
 2608:             wait_until(Fun)
 2609:     end.
 2610: 
 2611: %% Attempt to monitor pid as port, and port as pid
 2612: mon_port_invalid_type(_Config) ->
 2613:     Port = hd(erlang:ports()),
 2614:     ?assertError(badarg, erlang:monitor(port, self())),
 2615:     ?assertError(badarg, erlang:monitor(process, Port)),
 2616:     ok.
 2617: 
 2618: %% With local port
 2619: mon_port_local(Config) ->
 2620:     Port1 = create_port(Config, ["-h1", "-q"]), % will close after we send 1 byte
 2621:     Ref1 = erlang:monitor(port, Port1),
 2622:     ?assertMatch({proc_monitors, true, port_monitored_by, true},
 2623:                  port_is_monitored(self(), Port1)),
 2624:     Port1 ! {self(), {command, <<"1">>}}, % port test will close self immediately
 2625:     receive ExitP1 -> ?assertMatch({'DOWN', Ref1, port, Port1, _}, ExitP1)
 2626:     after 1000 -> ?assert(false) end,
 2627:     ?assertMatch({proc_monitors, false, port_monitored_by, false},
 2628:                  port_is_monitored(self(), Port1)),
 2629: 
 2630:     %% Trying to re-monitor a port which exists but is not healthy will
 2631:     %% succeed but then will immediately send DOWN
 2632:     Ref2 = erlang:monitor(port, Port1),
 2633:     receive ExitP2 -> ?assertMatch({'DOWN', Ref2, port, Port1, _}, ExitP2)
 2634:     after 1000 -> ?assert(false) end,
 2635:     ok.
 2636: 
 2637: %% With remote port on remote node (should fail)
 2638: mon_port_remote_on_remote(_Config) ->
 2639:     Port3 = binary_to_term(<<131, 102,          % Ext term format: PORT_EXT
 2640:                              100, 0, 13, "fgsfds@fgsfds", % Node :: ATOM_EXT
 2641:                              1:32/big,          % Id
 2642:                              0>>),              % Creation
 2643:     ?assertError(badarg, erlang:monitor(port, Port3)),
 2644:     ok.
 2645: 
 2646: %% Remote port belongs to this node and does not exist
 2647: %% Port4 produces #Port<0.167772160> which should not exist in a test run
 2648: mon_port_bad_remote_on_local(_Config) ->
 2649:     Port4 = binary_to_term(<<131, 102,          % Ext term format: PORT_EXT
 2650:                              100, 0, 13, "nonode@nohost", % Node
 2651:                              167772160:32/big,  % Id
 2652:                              0>>),              % Creation
 2653:     ?assertError(badarg, erlang:monitor(port, Port4)),
 2654:     ok.
 2655: 
 2656: %% Monitor owner (origin) dies before port is closed
 2657: mon_port_origin_dies(Config) ->
 2658:     Port5 = create_port(Config, ["-h1", "-q"]), % will close after we send 1 byte
 2659:     Self5 = self(),
 2660:     Proc5 = spawn(fun() ->
 2661:                       Self5 ! test5_started,
 2662:                       erlang:monitor(port, Port5),
 2663:                       receive stop -> ok end
 2664:                   end),
 2665:     erlang:monitor(process, Proc5), % we want to sync with its death
 2666:     receive test5_started -> ok
 2667:     after 1000 -> ?assert(false) end,
 2668:     ?assertMatch({proc_monitors, true, port_monitored_by, true},
 2669:                  port_is_monitored(Proc5, Port5)),
 2670:     Proc5 ! stop,
 2671:     % receive from monitor (removing race condition)
 2672:     receive ExitP5 -> ?assertMatch({'DOWN', _, process, Proc5, _}, ExitP5)
 2673:     after 1000 -> ?assert(false) end,
 2674:     ?assertMatch({proc_monitors, false, port_monitored_by, false},
 2675:                  port_is_monitored(Proc5, Port5)),
 2676:     Port5 ! {self(), {command, <<"1">>}}, % make port quit
 2677:     ok.
 2678: 
 2679: %% Port and Monitor owner dies before port is closed
 2680: %% This testcase checks for a regression memory leak in erts
 2681: %% when the controlling and monitoring process is the same process
 2682: %% and the process dies
 2683: mon_port_owner_dies(Config) ->
 2684:     Self = self(),
 2685:     Proc = spawn(fun() ->
 2686:                          Port = create_port(Config, ["-h1", "-q"]),
 2687:                          Self ! {test_started, Port},
 2688:                          erlang:monitor(port, Port),
 2689:                          receive stop -> ok end
 2690:                   end),
 2691:     erlang:monitor(process, Proc), % we want to sync with its death
 2692:     Port = receive {test_started,P} -> P
 2693:     after 1000 -> ?assert(false) end,
 2694:     ?assertMatch({proc_monitors, true, port_monitored_by, true},
 2695:                  port_is_monitored(Proc, Port)),
 2696:     Proc ! stop,
 2697:     %% receive from monitor
 2698:     receive ExitP5 -> ?assertMatch({'DOWN', _, process, Proc, _}, ExitP5)
 2699:     after 1000 -> ?assert(false) end,
 2700:     ok.
 2701: 
 2702: %% Monitor a named port
 2703: mon_port_named(Config) ->
 2704:     Name6 = test_port6,
 2705:     Port6 = create_port(Config, ["-h1", "-q"]), % will close after we send 1 byte
 2706:     erlang:register(Name6, Port6),
 2707:     erlang:monitor(port, Name6),
 2708:     ?assertMatch({proc_monitors, true, port_monitored_by, true},
 2709:                  port_is_monitored(self(), Name6)),
 2710:     Port6 ! {self(), {command, <<"1">>}}, % port test will close self immediately
 2711:     receive ExitP6 -> ?assertMatch({'DOWN', _, port, {Name6, _}, _}, ExitP6)
 2712:     after 1000 -> ?assert(false) end,
 2713:     ?assertMatch({proc_monitors, false, port_monitored_by, false},
 2714:                  port_is_monitored(self(), Name6)),
 2715:     ok.
 2716: 
 2717: %% Named does not exist: Should succeed but immediately send 'DOWN'
 2718: mon_port_bad_named(_Config) ->
 2719:     Name7 = test_port7,
 2720:     erlang:monitor(port, Name7),
 2721:     receive {'DOWN', _, port, {Name7, _}, noproc} -> ok
 2722:     after 1000 -> ?assert(false) end,
 2723:     ok.
 2724: 
 2725: %% Monitor a pid and demonitor by ref
 2726: mon_port_pid_demonitor(Config) ->
 2727:     Port8 = create_port(Config, ["-h1", "-q"]), % will close after we send 1 byte
 2728:     Ref8 = erlang:monitor(port, Port8),
 2729:     ?assertMatch({proc_monitors, true, port_monitored_by, true},
 2730:                  port_is_monitored(self(), Port8)),
 2731:     erlang:demonitor(Ref8),
 2732:     ?assertMatch({proc_monitors, false, port_monitored_by, false},
 2733:                  port_is_monitored(self(), Port8)),
 2734:     Port8 ! {self(), {command, <<"1">>}}, % port test will close self immediately
 2735:     ok.
 2736: 
 2737: %% Monitor by name and demonitor by ref
 2738: mon_port_name_demonitor(Config) ->
 2739:     Name9 = test_port9,
 2740:     Port9 = create_port(Config, ["-h1", "-q"]), % will close after we send 1 byte
 2741:     erlang:register(Name9, Port9),
 2742:     Ref9 = erlang:monitor(port, Name9),
 2743:     ?assertMatch({proc_monitors, true, port_monitored_by, true},
 2744:                  port_is_monitored(self(), Name9)),
 2745:     erlang:demonitor(Ref9),
 2746:     ?assertMatch({proc_monitors, false, port_monitored_by, false},
 2747:                  port_is_monitored(self(), Name9)),
 2748:     Port9 ! {self(), {command, <<"1">>}}, % port test will close self immediately
 2749:     ok.
 2750: 
 2751: %% 1. Spawn a port which will sleep 3 seconds
 2752: %% 2. Port driver and dies horribly (via C driver_failure call). This should
 2753: %%    mark port as exiting or something.
 2754: %% 3. While the command happens, a monitor is requested on the port
 2755: mon_port_driver_die(Config) ->
 2756:     erlang:process_flag(scheduler, 1),
 2757: 
 2758:     Path = proplists:get_value(data_dir, Config),
 2759:     ok = load_driver(Path, "sleep_failure_drv"),
 2760:     Port = open_port({spawn, "sleep_failure_drv"}, []),
 2761: 
 2762:     Self = self(),
 2763:     erlang:spawn_opt(fun() ->
 2764:                              timer:sleep(250),
 2765:                              Ref = erlang:monitor(port, Port),
 2766:                              %% Now check that msg actually arrives
 2767:                              receive
 2768:                                  {'DOWN', Ref, _Port2, _, _} = M -> Self ! M
 2769:                              after 3000 -> Self ! no_down_message
 2770:                              end
 2771:                      end,[{scheduler, 2}]),
 2772:     Port ! {self(), {command, "Fail, please!"}},
 2773:     receive
 2774:         A when is_atom(A) -> ?assertEqual(A, 'A_should_be_printed');
 2775:         {'DOWN', _R, port, Port, noproc} -> ok;
 2776:         {'DOWN', _R, _P, _, _} = M -> ct:fail({got_wrong_down,M})
 2777:     after 5000 -> ?assert(false)
 2778:     end,
 2779:     ok.
 2780: 
 2781: -ifdef(DISABLED_TESTCASE).
 2782: %% 1. Spawn a port which will sleep 3 seconds
 2783: %% 2. Monitor port
 2784: %% 3. Port driver and dies horribly (via C driver_failure call). This should
 2785: %%    mark port as exiting or something.
 2786: %% 4. While the command happens, a demonitor is requested on the port
 2787: mon_port_driver_die_demonitor(Config) ->
 2788:     erlang:process_flag(scheduler, 1),
 2789: 
 2790:     Path = proplists:get_value(data_dir, Config),
 2791:     ok = load_driver(Path, "sleep_failure_drv"),
 2792:     Port = open_port({spawn, "sleep_failure_drv"}, []),
 2793: 
 2794:     Self = self(),
 2795:     erlang:spawn_opt(
 2796:       fun() ->
 2797:               Ref = erlang:monitor(port, Port),
 2798:               Self ! Ref,
 2799:               timer:sleep(250),
 2800:               erlang:demonitor(Ref),
 2801:               %% Now check that msg still arrives,
 2802:               %% the demon should have arrived after
 2803:               %% the port exited
 2804:               receive
 2805:                   {'DOWN', Ref, _Port2, _, _} = M -> Self ! M
 2806:               after 3000 -> Self ! no_down_message
 2807:               end
 2808:       end,[{scheduler, 2}]),
 2809:     Ref = receive R -> R end,
 2810:     Port ! {self(), {command, "Fail, please!"}},
 2811:     receive
 2812:         {'DOWN', Ref, port, Port, normal} -> ok;
 2813:         {'DOWN', _R, _P, _, _} = M -> ct:fail({got_wrong_down,M})
 2814:     after 5000 -> ?assert(false)
 2815:     end,
 2816:     ok.
 2817: -endif.
 2818: 
 2819: %% @doc Makes a controllable port for testing. Underlying mechanism of this
 2820: %% port is not important, only important is our ability to close/kill it or
 2821: %% have it monitored.
 2822: create_port(Config, Args) ->
 2823:     DataDir = ?config(data_dir, Config),
 2824:     %% Borrow port test utility from port SUITE
 2825:     Program = filename:join([DataDir, "port_test"]),
 2826:     erlang:open_port({spawn_executable, Program}, [{args, Args}]).
 2827: 
 2828: %% @doc Checks if process Pid exists, and if so, if its monitoring (or not)
 2829: %% the Port (or if port doesn't exist, we assume answer is no).
 2830: port_is_monitored(Pid, Port) when is_pid(Pid), is_port(Port) ->
 2831:     %% Variant for when port is a port id (port())
 2832:     A = case erlang:process_info(Pid, monitors) of
 2833:             undefined -> false;
 2834:             {monitors, ProcMTargets} -> lists:member({port, Port}, ProcMTargets)
 2835:         end,
 2836:     B = case erlang:port_info(Port, monitored_by) of
 2837:             undefined -> false;
 2838:             {monitored_by, PortMonitors} -> lists:member(Pid, PortMonitors)
 2839:         end,
 2840:     {proc_monitors, A, port_monitored_by, B};
 2841: port_is_monitored(Pid, PortName) when is_pid(Pid), is_atom(PortName) ->
 2842:     %% Variant for when port is an atom
 2843:     A = case erlang:process_info(Pid, monitors) of
 2844:         undefined -> false;
 2845:         {monitors, ProcMTargets} ->
 2846:             lists:member({port, {PortName, node()}}, ProcMTargets)
 2847:     end,
 2848:     B = case erlang:whereis(PortName) of
 2849:             undefined -> false; % name is not registered or is dead
 2850:             PortId ->
 2851:                 case erlang:port_info(PortId, monitored_by) of
 2852:                     undefined -> false; % is dead
 2853:                     {monitored_by, PortMonitors} ->
 2854:                         lists:member(Pid, PortMonitors)
 2855:                 end
 2856:         end,
 2857:     {proc_monitors, A, port_monitored_by, B}.
 2858: 
 2859: %%
 2860: %%
 2861: %% Test cases testing for races when an exiting port receives a signal
 2862: %% (port_exit_signal_race group).
 2863: %%
 2864: %%
 2865: 
 2866: -record(esrt, {repeat = 1000,
 2867:                owner_sched = 0,
 2868:                prep_owner = fun (Prt) -> Prt end,
 2869:                post_owner = fun (_) -> ok end,
 2870:                send_sched_start = 0,
 2871:                senders = 1,
 2872:                prep_signal = fun (Prt, PrtOwn) -> {Prt, PrtOwn} end,
 2873:                signal,
 2874:                post_signal = fun (_) -> ok end}).
 2875: 
 2876: port_exit_monitor_race(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 2877:     ESRT0 = prepare_port_exit_signal_race_test(Config),
 2878:     ESRT = ESRT0#esrt{signal = fun ({Port, _PrtOwn}) ->
 2879:                                        {Port, erlang:monitor(port, Port)}
 2880:                                end,
 2881:                       post_signal = fun ({Port, Mon}) ->
 2882:                                             receive
 2883:                                                 {'DOWN', Mon, port, Port, Reason} ->
 2884:                                                     if Reason == noproc -> ok;
 2885:                                                        Reason == normal -> ok;
 2886:                                                        true -> exit({unexpected_reason, Reason})
 2887:                                                     end
 2888:                                             after
 2889:                                                 1000 ->
 2890:                                                     exit(missing_down_message)
 2891:                                             end
 2892:                                     end},
 2893:     repeat_port_exit_signal_race_test(ESRT).
 2894: 
 2895: port_exit_demonitor_race(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 2896:     ESRT0 = prepare_port_exit_signal_race_test(Config),
 2897:     ESRT = ESRT0#esrt{prep_signal = fun (Port, _PrtOwn) ->
 2898:                                             erlang:monitor(port, Port)
 2899:                                     end,
 2900:                       signal = fun (Mon) ->
 2901:                                        erlang:demonitor(Mon, [flush])
 2902:                                end},
 2903:     repeat_port_exit_signal_race_test(ESRT).
 2904: 
 2905: port_exit_link_race(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 2906:     ESRT0 = prepare_port_exit_signal_race_test(Config),
 2907:     ESRT = ESRT0#esrt{prep_signal = fun (Port, _PrtOwn) ->
 2908:                                             process_flag(trap_exit, true),
 2909:                                             Port
 2910:                                     end,
 2911:                       signal = fun (Port) ->
 2912:                                        link(Port),
 2913:                                        Port
 2914:                                end,
 2915:                       post_signal = fun (Port) ->
 2916:                                             receive
 2917:                                                 {'EXIT', Port, Reason} ->
 2918:                                                     if Reason == noproc -> ok;
 2919:                                                        Reason == normal -> ok;
 2920:                                                        true -> exit({unexpected_reason, Reason})
 2921:                                                     end
 2922:                                             after
 2923:                                                 1000 ->
 2924:                                                     exit(missing_exit_message)
 2925:                                             end
 2926:                                     end},
 2927:     repeat_port_exit_signal_race_test(ESRT).
 2928: 
 2929: port_exit_unlink_race(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 2930:     ESRT0 = prepare_port_exit_signal_race_test(Config),
 2931:     ESRT = ESRT0#esrt{prep_signal = fun (Port, _PrtOwn) ->
 2932:                                             process_flag(trap_exit, true),
 2933:                                             link(Port),
 2934:                                             Port
 2935:                                     end,
 2936:                       signal = fun (Port) ->
 2937:                                        unlink(Port),
 2938:                                        Port
 2939:                                end,
 2940:                       post_signal = fun (Port) ->
 2941:                                             receive
 2942:                                                 {'EXIT', Port, Reason} ->
 2943:                                                     if Reason == noproc -> ok;
 2944:                                                        Reason == normal -> ok;
 2945:                                                        true -> exit({unexpected_reason, Reason})
 2946:                                                     end
 2947:                                             after
 2948:                                                 0 ->
 2949:                                                     ok
 2950:                                             end
 2951:                                     end},
 2952:     repeat_port_exit_signal_race_test(ESRT).
 2953: 
 2954: port_exit_command_race(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 2955:     ESRT0 = prepare_port_exit_signal_race_test(Config),
 2956:     ESRT = ESRT0#esrt{signal = fun ({Port, PortOwner}) ->
 2957:                                        Port ! {PortOwner, {command, "halloj"}},
 2958:                                        Port
 2959:                                end,
 2960:                       post_signal = fun (Port) ->
 2961:                                             receive
 2962:                                                 {Port, Data} ->
 2963:                                                     {data, "halloj"} = Data
 2964:                                             after
 2965:                                                 0 ->
 2966:                                                     ok
 2967:                                             end
 2968:                                     end},
 2969:     repeat_port_exit_signal_race_test(ESRT).
 2970: 
 2971: port_exit_connect_race(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 2972:     %% We connect the port to the same port owner that it already has
 2973:     %% otherwise we will get badsig issues since the owner close the
 2974:     %% port as itself. The port owner will be spammed by {Port,
 2975:     %% connected} messages but we ignore those...
 2976:     ESRT0 = prepare_port_exit_signal_race_test(Config),
 2977:     ESRT = ESRT0#esrt{signal = fun ({Port, PortOwner}) ->
 2978:                                        Port ! {PortOwner, {connect, PortOwner}},
 2979:                                        Port
 2980:                                end},
 2981:     repeat_port_exit_signal_race_test(ESRT).
 2982: 
 2983: 
 2984: port_exit_close_race(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 2985:     ESRT0 = prepare_port_exit_signal_race_test(Config),
 2986:     ESRT = ESRT0#esrt{signal = fun ({Port, PortOwner}) ->
 2987:                                        Port ! {PortOwner, close},
 2988:                                        Port
 2989:                                end},
 2990:     repeat_port_exit_signal_race_test(ESRT).
 2991: 
 2992: port_exit_exit_race(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 2993:     ESRT0 = prepare_port_exit_signal_race_test(Config),
 2994:     ESRT = ESRT0#esrt{signal = fun ({Port, _PortOwner}) ->
 2995:                                        exit(Port, normal)
 2996:                                end},
 2997:     repeat_port_exit_signal_race_test(ESRT).
 2998: 
 2999: port_exit_command_request_race(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 3000:     ESRT0 = prepare_port_exit_signal_race_test(Config),
 3001:     ESRT = ESRT0#esrt{signal = fun ({Port, _PortOwner}) ->
 3002:                                        true = try
 3003:                                                   erlang:port_command(Port, "hejsan")
 3004:                                               catch
 3005:                                                   error:badarg ->
 3006:                                                       true
 3007:                                               end,
 3008:                                        Port
 3009:                                end,
 3010:                       post_signal = fun (Port) ->
 3011:                                             receive
 3012:                                                 {Port, Data} ->
 3013:                                                     {data, "hejsan"} = Data
 3014:                                             after
 3015:                                                 0 ->
 3016:                                                     ok
 3017:                                             end
 3018:                                     end},
 3019:     repeat_port_exit_signal_race_test(ESRT).
 3020: 
 3021: port_exit_connect_request_race(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 3022:     %% We connect the port to the same port owner that it already has
 3023:     %% otherwise we will get badsig issues since the owner close the
 3024:     %% port as itself.
 3025:     ESRT0 = prepare_port_exit_signal_race_test(Config),
 3026:     ESRT = ESRT0#esrt{signal = fun ({Port, PortOwner}) ->
 3027:                                        true = try
 3028:                                                   erlang:port_connect(Port, PortOwner)
 3029:                                               catch
 3030:                                                   error:badarg ->
 3031:                                                       true
 3032:                                               end
 3033:                                end},
 3034:     repeat_port_exit_signal_race_test(ESRT).
 3035: 
 3036: port_exit_close_request_race(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 3037:     ESRT0 = prepare_port_exit_signal_race_test(Config),
 3038:     ESRT = ESRT0#esrt{signal = fun ({Port, _PortOwner}) ->
 3039:                                        true = try
 3040:                                                   erlang:port_close(Port)
 3041:                                               catch
 3042:                                                   error:badarg ->
 3043:                                                       true
 3044:                                               end,
 3045:                                        Port
 3046:                                end},
 3047:     repeat_port_exit_signal_race_test(ESRT).
 3048: 
 3049: port_exit_control_request_race(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 3050:     ESRT0 = prepare_port_exit_signal_race_test(Config),
 3051:     ESRT = ESRT0#esrt{signal = fun ({Port, _PortOwner}) ->
 3052:                                        [] = try
 3053:                                                 erlang:port_control(Port, 0, [])
 3054:                                             catch
 3055:                                                 error:badarg ->
 3056:                                                     []
 3057:                                             end
 3058:                                end},
 3059:     repeat_port_exit_signal_race_test(ESRT).
 3060: 
 3061: port_exit_call_request_race(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 3062:     ESRT0 = prepare_port_exit_signal_race_test(Config),
 3063:     ESRT = ESRT0#esrt{signal = fun ({Port, _PortOwner}) ->
 3064:                                        [] = try
 3065:                                                 erlang:port_call(Port, 0, term_to_binary([]))
 3066:                                             catch
 3067:                                                 error:badarg ->
 3068:                                                     []
 3069:                                             end
 3070:                                end},
 3071:     repeat_port_exit_signal_race_test(ESRT).
 3072: 
 3073: port_exit_info_request_race(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 3074:     ESRT0 = prepare_port_exit_signal_race_test(Config),
 3075:     ESRT = ESRT0#esrt{signal = fun ({Port, PortOwner}) ->
 3076:                                        case erlang:port_info(Port, connected) of
 3077:                                            {connected, PortOwner} -> ok;
 3078:                                            undefined -> ok;
 3079:                                            Unexpected -> exit({unexpected_info, Unexpected})
 3080:                                        end
 3081:                                end},
 3082:     repeat_port_exit_signal_race_test(ESRT).
 3083: 
 3084: 
 3085: prepare_port_exit_signal_race_test(Config) ->
 3086:     Path = proplists:get_value(data_dir, Config),
 3087:     ok = load_driver(Path, "echo_drv"),
 3088:     process_flag(scheduler, 1),
 3089:     case erlang:system_info(schedulers_online) of
 3090:         1 ->
 3091:             #esrt{};
 3092:         2 ->
 3093:             #esrt{owner_sched = 2,
 3094:                   send_sched_start = 1,
 3095:                   senders = 1};
 3096:         3 ->
 3097:             #esrt{owner_sched = 2,
 3098:                   send_sched_start = 3,
 3099:                   senders = 1};
 3100:         N ->
 3101:             #esrt{owner_sched = 2,
 3102:                   send_sched_start = 3,
 3103:                   senders = N - 3}
 3104:     end.
 3105: 
 3106: repeat_port_exit_signal_race_test(#esrt{repeat = N} = ESRT) ->
 3107:     repeat_port_exit_signal_race_test(N, ESRT).
 3108: 
 3109: repeat_port_exit_signal_race_test(0, #esrt{}) ->
 3110:     ok;
 3111: repeat_port_exit_signal_race_test(N, #esrt{} = ESRT) ->
 3112:     port_exit_signal_race_test(ESRT),
 3113:     repeat_port_exit_signal_race_test(N-1, ESRT).
 3114: 
 3115: port_exit_signal_race_test(#esrt{owner_sched = OwnSched,
 3116:                                  prep_owner = PrepOwner,
 3117:                                  post_owner = PostOwner,
 3118:                                  send_sched_start = SendSchedStart,
 3119:                                  senders = Senders,
 3120:                                  prep_signal = PrepSignal,
 3121:                                  signal = Signal,
 3122:                                  post_signal = PostSignal}) ->
 3123:     %% Send a close signal to the port simultaneously as another signal
 3124:     %% is sent (from multiple senders). We try to provoke races between
 3125:     %% the port entering an exiting state and handling of the signal. Such
 3126:     %% races have shown themselves as either stray messages to signal
 3127:     %% sender or runtime system crashes.
 3128:     Parent = self(),
 3129:     {PrtOwn,
 3130:      PrtOwnMon} = spawn_opt(fun () ->
 3131:                                     Prt = erlang:open_port({spawn_driver, "echo_drv"}, []),
 3132:                                     true = is_port(Prt),
 3133:                                     OwnState = PrepOwner(Prt),
 3134:                                     Prt ! {self(), {command, "hej"}},
 3135:                                     receive
 3136:                                         {Prt, Data} ->
 3137:                                             {data, "hej"} = Data
 3138:                                     end,
 3139:                                     Parent ! {prepared, self(), Prt},
 3140:                                     receive {go, Parent} -> ok end,
 3141:                                     Prt ! {self(), close},
 3142:                                     PostOwner(OwnState)
 3143:                             end,
 3144:                             [link, monitor, {scheduler, OwnSched}]),
 3145:     Port = receive {prepared, PrtOwn, Prt} -> Prt end,
 3146:     PMs = lists:map(fun (SendSched) ->
 3147:                             spawn_opt(fun () ->
 3148:                                               PrtMon = erlang:monitor(port, Port),
 3149:                                               SigState1 = PrepSignal(Port, PrtOwn),
 3150:                                               Parent ! {prepared, self()},
 3151:                                               receive {go, Parent} -> ok end,
 3152:                                               SigState2 = Signal(SigState1),
 3153:                                               receive {'DOWN', PrtMon, port, Port, _} -> ok end,
 3154:                                               receive {bye, Parent} -> ok end,
 3155:                                               PostSignal(SigState2),
 3156:                                               receive Msg -> exit({unexpected_msg, Msg})
 3157:                                               after 0 -> ok
 3158:                                               end
 3159:                                       end,
 3160:                                       [link, monitor, {scheduler, SendSched}])
 3161:                     end,
 3162:                     lists:seq(SendSchedStart, SendSchedStart + Senders - 1)), 
 3163:     lists:foreach(fun ({P, _M}) -> receive {prepared, P} -> ok end end, PMs),
 3164:     PrtOwn ! {go, self()},
 3165:     lists:foreach(fun ({P, _M}) -> P ! {go, self()} end, PMs),
 3166:     receive
 3167:         {'DOWN', PrtOwnMon, process, PrtOwn, OwnReason} ->
 3168:             normal = OwnReason
 3169:     end,
 3170:     lists:foreach(fun ({P, _M}) -> P ! {bye, self()} end, PMs),
 3171:     lists:foreach(fun ({P, M}) ->
 3172:                           receive
 3173:                               {'DOWN', M, process, P, SigSndReason} ->
 3174:                                   normal = SigSndReason
 3175:                           end
 3176:                   end,
 3177:                   PMs),
 3178:     ok.
 3179: 
 3180: %%
 3181: %%
 3182: %% End of test cases testing for races when an exiting port receives a signal
 3183: %% (port_exit_signal_race group).
 3184: %%
 3185: %%
